loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is a hardworking person who devotes his time to his livestock business. Arturo is married having four children. He lives with his wife and their children in the village of Salinungan West San Mateo.

Arturo is raising three sows. He has been in this line of business for more than 20 years. As an additional source of income, Arturo also raises rice crops on his 7 hectares of rice field. He spends his profit on his two children, who are still students and on the maintenance of his rice field. For this reason, his capital for livestock is no longer enough. So, he would like to take out for a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos. This amount will be used to purchase hog feed, vitamins and vaccines to make his hogs healthy and ensure they reach their optimum growth. He hopes that his requested loan will be granted so he will be able to let his two children finish their studies and be able to improve their way of living.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed, vitamins and vaccine for his hogs

loans.name: Amanecer Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento AMANECER PARA TRIUNFAR,  Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes todas mujeres,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Verónica tiene 31 años, y cuatro hijos que son de las edades de 3, 6, 8  y 11 años,  La Sra. Verónica se dedica  a la   venta bisutería en su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado por la zona Aygachi de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece variedad de  productos,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, es cliente antigua, la Sra. Verónica va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de bisutería por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad bisutería  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Verónica va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando  productos, la Sra. Verónica es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Amanecer Para Triunfar has nine members, all of them women. The president of the bank is Verónica. She is 31 years old and has four children who are 3, 6, 8, and 11 years old.

Verónica works selling costume jewelry in her stall that is located in the area of Aygachi in the city of La Paz. She offers a variety of products. This loan is her third cycle within the institution, she is an old client.

Verónica is going to use this loan to buy wholesale costume jewelry in order to provide a variety of jewelry to her customers thereby increasing her earnings. Her reason for asking for this loan is to continue improving her business.

Verónica is going to use the profits to continue buying products. Verónica is a hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity given to her and her group members because in some cases they are the sole support of their families.

loans.use: to buy wholesale costume jewelry in order to provide a variety of jewelry to her customers and to continue improving her business

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is a 34-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Ten years ago, Hadija decided to set up a retail shop in her trading centre to bring goods nearer to her customers and also to be able to earn income for her family. She is challenged by customers not paying on time, price fluctuation due to the current inflation rate, and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand. She did not have a chance to further her education because her parents could not afford school fees, but now she struggles to send her children to school and also wants to build a permanent house. She intends to own a wholesale shop and buy land to grow crops. Hadija is requesting a loan to buy beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans

loans.name: Chicas Azucar De Mercurio Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento CHICAS AZUCAR DE MERCURIO está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varónes, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Sonia tiene 37 años y es viuda, no hace mucho, cuenta la Sra. que fue un golpe para ella ya que tuboi que quedarse sola a cargo de sus cuatro hijos que son de las edades de 9, 7, 4 y 2 años vive por la zona Tomas Frías,  La Sra. Sonia,   se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Sonia va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de productos para surtir su negocio como abarrotes y refrescos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Sonia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Sonia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias. en la foto una de las socias se encuentra con su esposo.
texts.en:
The communal bank CHICAS AZUCAR DE MERCURIO is made up of eight members: six women and two men. The president of the bank is Sonia, 37, who recently became a widow. According to Sonia, it hit her hard because she was left alone to take care of her four children, ages nine, seven, four and two. She lives in the region of Tomas Frías.

Sonia makes a living selling a variety of convenience store items in her neighborhood store, located in the same area where she lives. This will be her third loan cycle within this institution. Sonia is going to use this loan for the purchase of a variety of products, such as groceries and sodas, to stock up her business, and in this way offer an assortment of products to her customers. The reason she is requesting this loan is to be able to continue improving her business. 

Sonia will use the profits to keep purchasing products and increasing her earnings in this way. Her business wish is to have a grocery store and that way she can offer better service to her clientele.

Sonia is a very hard-working person. She feels happy for the opportunity offered to herself and to her female group mates, since in many cases they alone are the ones who propel their families forward. In the photo, one of the group's partners is shown with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products, such as groceries and sodas, to stock up her business

loans.name: Luis Isaias

texts.es:
Don Luis, de 33 años de edad, es casado, Comerciante, tiene 3 niños menores de edad quienes estudian la primaria, habita en la zona # 6, Don Luis se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta, trabajadora y esforzado, ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia que tanto ama, tiene un espiritu de superacion con mucho positivismo. 				
Solicita el segundo crédito a Kiva con el objetivo de comprar materiales de construcción y realizar un dormitorio para su mamá, pues cabe hacer mencion que con el credito anterior logró cambiar el techo de la Vivienda, de esta forma ha mejorarado las condiciones de vida del núcleo familiar.				
Su sueño es ir acondiciónando poco a poco su vivienda y brindarles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is thirty-three years old and married. He is a businessman and has three children, all minors, who are in primary school. He lives in Zone # 6 (in the municipality of Nueva Guinea, Nicaragua). He is known for being an honest, hardworking, and determined person. He has fought to carry forward the family that he loves so much. He has an overcoming spirit and is very positive.
		
He is requesting his second Kiva loan with the objective of buying construction materials and building a bedroom for his mother. It is worth mentioning that with the previous loan he was able to replace the roof on his home and in this way has improved living conditions for his nuclear family.

His dream is to continue improving his house little by little in order to provide his family with the best possible home.

loans.use: replace his roof and construct a kitchen

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nancy hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
This is Janet, who previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Janet hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
This is Jovelyn, 33, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Erwin and a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jovelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jovelyn hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is a single mother of four children. Only two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a granddaughter). She resides in her own house. The family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication. 

Hadjah has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for six years. She works at the market seven days a week and sells to all kinds of people but on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  

Hadjah has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She is hoping to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms and to educate her remaining children up to university.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
This is Janet. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used buy more raw products and supplies. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Janet dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Manth

texts.en:
Manth is in a direct selling business from a rented booth at a local market, situated in Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. She especially sells dried fish that she makes out of fresh fish to her customers, generating a good income of 7.00 USD each day on average. Her husband is also running the same type of business but he does it at mobile markets around his neighborhood. They both have been involved in this for almost two years. Manth is 47 years old and responsible for five single children.

Manth would like to increase her stock of dried fish to sell in her store, but due to inadequate capital she has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva. This loan will enable to her to sustain her current business as well as to make a consistent income to support her living needs. She hopes that lenders will keep lending loans to her, so that her standard of living will improve gradually.

loans.use: to purchase stock of dried fish to sell in her store.

loans.name: Norietta

texts.en:
This is Norietta, 47, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Pio who is a driver and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Norietta maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Norietta's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Norietta hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, who is from Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia, is 28 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. She and her spouse both work as they bring up their children. She has been employed as a garment worker for more than two years, while her husband works for a private security company.

Touch came to the HKL branch office and applied for a loan of 700 USD to reduce her transportation costs through the purchase of a motorcycle for commuting to her workplace. She believes that this purchase will enable her to save more of her salary and thereby improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to her workplaces.

loans.name: Lovella

texts.en:
This is Lovella, 37, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Anthony and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lovella operates a grocery store. Other retailers who have variety stores go to her to buy their products and stocks where they can get goods at a lower price.  She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales daily.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of coffee to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lovella hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Monette

texts.en:
Monette is recognized as a responsible mother. She is 31 years old and is married with three children. To earn a living, Monette is engaged in the retailing business, in which she sells common goods. 

Monette wants to expand her business to increase her daily income. In this regard, Monette is asking for a loan in the amount of 30,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, noodles, condiments, soft drinks and assorted bread to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store. She hopes to increase her income so that she can sustain the financial needs of the family and save money for the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, condiments, soft drinks and assorted bread to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store.

loans.name: María Catalina

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte del banco comunal Las Flores, es una socia activa desde hace 3 años. Vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene su cultura y su tradición muy bien arraigadas en su cotidianidad de su gente, la gastronomía típica cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 40 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 7 años de edad y está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en un taller de latonería (arreglo de latas de vehículos), no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella es una mujer emprendedora por lo que conjuntamente con su hermana han puesto un local de venta de pinturas, negocio el cual tienen hace 5 años y laboran de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pinturas para crecer más en su negocio. 

Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank, Las Flores, and has been an active member for the past three years. She lives in the Totoracocha sector of the city of Cuenca, whose culture and traditions are very deeply entrenched in the daily life of its people. The typical cuisine of the region captivates the palates of natives and visitors.

María is a very hardworking woman. She is forty years old, married, and has a seven-year old daughter with her husband. Her daughter goes to a little school in the neighborhood. Her husband works in an auto body shop. They don't have a home of their own and so live in a rented one.

She is an enterprising woman and has started a paint sales store with her sister. They have had the business for five years now and they work Monday to Saturday from 8:00 in the morning until 7:00 at night. 

She will use the loan to buy paints to grow her business further.

Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy paints

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Raising hogs has been Daniel's business. He has been running this kind of business for more than 15 years. According to him, the main source of income for his family comes primarily from his farming business. He is really glad that his sacrifices and determination in life have brought him the realization of his dreams.

Daniel would like to have continuous growth of his livestock and farming business to be able to educate all three of his children. Two children have finished their degree courses. His main priority at this time is to increase the income he generates from his livestock and farming business to be able to cover their daily needs, educate his three children and improve their way of living. The capital for his livestock business is no longer enough – that's the reason he is asking for a loan of 27,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to allow him to buy sacs of hog feed, vaccines and vitamins to ensure proper growth of his hogs. He believes that this money will give him the hope of attaining his goal.

loans.use: to buy sacs of hog feed, vaccines and vitamins to nourish his hogs

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz se encuentra en el séptimo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Las Flores, vive por la parroquia de Ricaurte en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene su cultura y su tradición muy bien arraigadas en su cotidianidad de su gente, la gastronomía típica cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Doña Luz tiene 66 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes ahora son mayores de edad, seis de ellos están casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad siendo el fruto del trabajo conyugal en su juventud, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

La Señora Luz labora en el arduo trabajo que representa los quehaceres de su hogar, se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos, también tiene una tienda desde hace 40 años y trabaja en la misma de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda.
 
Su meta es seguir agrandando su tienda para tener más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Luz now finds herself approaching her seventh loan with the communal bank Las Flores. She lives in the Ricuarte parish of the city of Cuenca, whose culture and traditions are very deeply entrenched in the daily life of its people. The typical cuisine of the region captivates the palates of locals and visitors alike. 

Luz is sixty-six years old, married, and has seven children with her husband, all of whom have now reached their majority, and six of whom are married and live independently. Her single son works and they help him financially. The house in which she lives is her property, being the fruit of her and her husband's labors in their youth. Her husband makes his living in agriculture.

Luz does the arduous work of maintaining their home, dedicating herself to the care of guinea pigs and chickens. She has also had a store for the past forty years and works there from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule.
 
She will use this loan to buy provisions for her shop.

Her goal is to continue expanding her store in order to have a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Lach is operating a general store in her neighborhood of Kampong Chhnang province. And this is her supplementary business after rice farming. She typically generates approximately 2.00 USD through sales activities. Lach is 51 years old and a widowed mother of two children as her husband passed away in the past few years. Both of her children have started their new families and have an independent living.

Lach wants to increase her stock of merchandise to satisfy her customers. As a result, she is taking out a loan in the amount of 200 USD to purchase noodles, canned items, snack foods, beverages, sweets, spices, personal care products and miscellaneous household products. Through this purchase, Lach hopes to have more customers and thus boost her income.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned items, snack foods, beverages, sweets, spices, personal care products and miscellaneous household products.

loans.name: Teresa Viviana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 13,  11, 6 y el menor un bebe de 4 meses de nacido, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, de tres a cuatro  días a la semana sale a recorrer con sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y  cobra cada 8 días,  la mercadería la va a comprar cada quince días a Guayaquil o cuando  necesita. Lleva  6  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y productos de Esika.  Lleva 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito emprendió su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Mujeres Unidas meets twice a month in the canton of Jipijapa. This canton is known as the Sultana of coffee because of the extensive cultivation of coffee which has an incomparable flavor, for its cuisine, and for the warmth of the people.

Teresa lives in this place. She is 29 years old. She is married and has 4 children who are 13, 11, 6, and a baby of 4 months of age. The two oldest are in middle school and the younger is in primary. Her husband is a security guard.

With the intention of earning something on her own and helping her husband with the household expenses she is engaged in commerce, selling all types of clothing and products from Esika (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories.) She sells door-to-door, three or four days a week, going out with her products and leaving them on credit and collecting payment every eight days. She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise every fifteen days or when she needs to. She has been in this business for six years and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses shirts and Esika products. She has been a member of the communal bank for six years and she likes it because with the first loan she started her business. Her dream is to have a car to use on her route.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and products from Esika to sell in order to help meet the household expenses

loans.name: Elizabeth Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Elizabeth tiene 34 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18,  16 y de 8 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela.

Ella para poder salir adelante y para que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada se dedica a la venta de comida para lo cual puso hace más de seis años un  pequeño comedor en su casa, allí todos los días por la tardes  prepara deliciosos platos, su especialidad son las deliciosa fritada acompañada de plátano asado o patacones lo cual es muy apetecido por sus clientes, trabaja sola y a veces con la ayuda de sus hijos cuando ellos están desocupados, es así como ella sale sola adelante con sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros  víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  10 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" ["Women United"] meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa canton, a canton known as the "Coffee Sultaness" for its extensive plantings of coffee, which has an incomparable flavor. Jipijapa is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of its people. In this place lives 34-year-old Elizabeth. She is separated and has three children, ages 18, 16, and 8. The two older children are in secondary school and the youngest is in primary school. To make a living and so that her children never lack anything, Elizabeth works selling food. More than six years ago, she set up a small eatery in her house. There she prepares delicious dishes every afternoon. Her specialty is fritada with roasted plantains or patacones, which is very appetizing to her customers. She works alone and sometimes with the help of her children, when they aren't busy. This is how she supports her children by herself. She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other groceries for the preparation of her foods. She has been in the communal bank for ten years and she likes it for the help they give her with the loans. Her goals are to carry on with her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gloria Aida

texts.es:
La Señora. Gloria es una socia activa del banco comunal Las Flores hace 6 meses y este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene su cultura y su tradición muy bien arraigadas en su cotidianidad de su gente, la gastronomía típica cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Doña Gloria tiene 26 años, es divorciada pero en su unión conyugal han concebido dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive en es de su propiedad.

La Señora Gloria tiene una pequeña fábrica de marmolería en donde realiza varios productos como mesones de cocina, aprendió este oficio de sus padres y cuenta con su negocio propio hace 5 años, le gusta laborar en esta actividad porque le permite ser independiente y así tiene tiempo para dedicarse a su hogar.
 
Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de mármol para su negocio y la cancelación de su crédito lo ha realizado a la fecha sin dificultad alguna. Este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mármol. La banca comunal le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le permiten solventar los gastos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria has been an active member of the communal bank Las Flores for the past six months and this is her second loan with the bank. She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca, a city whose culture and traditions are deeply entrenched in the daily life of its people, and whose typical cuisine captivates the palates of locals and visitors alike.

Gloria is twenty-six years old and divorced, though she has two children from her previous marriage of seven and five years of age. They study in a little school in the city. The house in which she lives is her own property.

Gloria has a small marble factory in which she produces a variety of products such as kitchen countertops. She learned this profession from her parents and she has had her own business for the past five years. She likes the work because it permits her to be independent and this way she has time to spend in her home.

She used the previous loan to purchase marble for her business and she has paid back the loan within the allotted period without any difficulty whatsoever. She will use this loan to purchase more marble. She likes the communal bank because the loans are fast and they permit her to settle her business expenses.

loans.use: to purchase marble.

loans.name: Gladys Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad e independiente. Su esposo es panadero.

Ella junto al esposo  tienen un negocio de panadería  en el centro de la ciudad en un local que alquilan desde que iniciaron el negocio hace mas de 25 años, allí trabajan todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana,  además de pan también preparan pasteles y dulces para toda ocasión,  tienen mucha clientela ya que le dan un sabor único al pan lo cual es de mucho agrado de sus clientes que dia a dia compran en su local.

Este crédito es para  comprar harina, azúcar, manteca y varios ingredientes más que se utilizan en la preparación del pan. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 12 años,  es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque con los créditos ha logrado salir adelante.
 
Sus sueños son tener su propio local ya que el gasto de arriendo se le lleva buena parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Unidas ("Women United") meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa, a canton known by the name of the wife of the coffee sultan because of the extensive crops of coffee that are grown here, which have an incomparable flavor. It is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

In this place lives Gladys, who is fifty-four years old, married, and has one son from her marriage. He is already of age and independent. Her husband is a baker.

She along with her husband has a bakery in the center of the city in a space they have rented since they started the business more than twenty-five years ago. There they work every day beginning at five in the morning. In addition to bread they prepare cakes and sweets for all occasions. They have a large clientele since they impart to their bread a unique flavor which is very popular with the people who buy from them day to day.

This loan is to buy flour, sugar, butter, and various other ingredients that they will use in the preparation of the bread. She has been in the communal bank for the past twelve years, is president of the group, and likes the bank because with the help of these loans she has been able to get ahead.

Her dream is to have her own space since the expense of rent carries away a good part of their earnings.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, and other ingredients

loans.name: Mariuxi Mercedes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por las extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Mariuxi tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 8 y 1 año de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es panadero.
 
Ella junto al esposo  tienen una panadería en su casa, allí trabajan todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana, luego ella venden en su local mientras que su marido sale en una motocicleta a recorrer por lugares mas alejados de la ciudad donde tiene muchos clientes, la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza de esa forma su esposo ya que les lleva el pan hasta sus hogares.

Este crédito es para  comprar harina, azúcar, manteca y otros ingredientes más que se utilizan en la preparación del pan. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 10 años,  le gusta por la ayuda y por la seriedad de la institución que siempre piensa en su beneficio. 

Su sueño es tener un gran local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The community bank Mujeres Unidas (United Women) meets every fifteen days in Cantón Jipijapa, a canton known by the name sultan of coffee, for its extensive cultivation of coffee which has an incomparable flavor, for its gastronomy and for the warmth of its people. 

Mariuxi, a 35-year-old woman, lives here and has a common law husband with whom she has three children, ages fourteen, eight, and one. The two older children are students in high school and elementary school. Mariuxi's husband is a baker. 

She and her husband have a bakery in their house. They work there every day starting at five o'clock in the morning. Soon Mariuxi begins selling from the home while her husband leaves on a motorcycle to travel to places farther out of the city where he has many customers. Her husband makes most of their sales in this way, because he delivers the bread to their homes.

This loan is for the purchase of flour, sugar, lard and other ingredients that are used in the preparation of bread. Mariuxi has been in the Community Bank for ten years. She likes it for the help it provides, and for the seriousness of the institution, which always has her profits in mind.

Her dream is to have a large establishment in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, lard and other ingredients

loans.name: Ena Jesús

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Ena, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero cuatro  de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Ella para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres además de  legumbres, verduras y frutas,  además de ciertas cosas de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayuda en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden,  lleva más de 14 años con su negocio y está muy contenta ya que allí se siente útil realizando una actividad que le deja muy buenos beneficios sin salir de su casa.
 
Este crédito lo va a invertir en víveres para surtir más su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace más de 16  años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton. It is known as the Sultana of Coddee, because of the extensive coffee crops which have an incomparable flavor. It is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of its people. 

This is where Ena lives. She is 61 years old, married and the mother of six children. They are already grown but four of them still live with her. Her husband is a farmer.

To help out with the household expenses, she has a small store in her house. She sells all types of groceries there in addition to vegetables, produce and fruit. She aslo sells certain variety items and paper products. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. and sometimes even later. Her children help her with the work when they can. She has had the business for more than 14 years and she is very happy since she feels useful doing an activity and it brings her great benefits without having to leave her house.
 
She is going to invest this loan in stocking her store. She has been in the communal banl since the beginning, more than 16 years ago. She likes it because she has made more friends in the group.

Her goals are to keep going ahead in her business and for her store to grow every day.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Martha Ines

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 44 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  los mismos que ya son mayores de edad y estudian en la universidad. Su esposo es técnico dental.

Ella es una ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ella y para que su marido lo utilice en su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, lleva más de 10 años con su negocio y le gusta lo que hace ya que se siente útil y con sus ganancias  puede ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos de sus estudios. 
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y para materiales odontológicos para el trabajo de su esposo. Lleva 16 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la seriedad de sus compañeras del grupo.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas  communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton. It is known as the Sultana of  Coffee, because of its extensive coffee crops which have an incomparable flavor. It is also known for its cuisine and for the warmth of its people.
 
This is where Martha lives. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of two children. They are grown and got to college. Her husband is a dental technician.

She is a housewife who is taking out the loan for herself and  her husband to use at work. She sells clothes via catalogue door to door. She has been doing. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and she likes it because she feels useful and her earnings can help her children with their education expenses.
 
This loan is to buy clothes and dentistry materials for her husband's work. She has been in the communal bank for 16 years and she likes the seriousness of the other members of the group. 

Her dream is for her children to have good careers.

loans.use: to buy clothes and dentistry materials.

loans.name: Victoria Magdalena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar 	vive la señora Victoria, tiene 52 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos uno de ellos es mayor de edad y otro de 16 el mismo que estudia en colegio, ambos aún viven con y ella el mayor es un chico especial. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la compra y  venta de caña guadua y frutas, compra la caña a los agricultores de la zona y luego él las corta para  llevarlas a entregara  a ciertos depósitos de madera o las lleva hasta Guayaquil lugar donde le pagan a muy buen precio, allí también lleva a entregar sus frutas en especial la guanábana que es la que más  vende.
  
Este crédito es para que su esposo compre caña guadua y frutas y pueda seguir con su negocio. Lleva 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su sueño es comprar un camión para llevar sus productos.
texts.en:
The Mujeries Unidas communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton. It is known as the Sultana of Coffee, because of the extensive coffee crops which have an incomparable flavor. It is also known for its gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

This is where Victoria lives. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of two children. One of them is grown and the other is 16 and in high school. Both of them still live with her; the oldest is a special child. Her husband is a merchant.

She is a housewife who is taking out a loan so her husband can use it in his business. He buys and sells bamboo and fruit. He buys the bamboo from farmers in the area and later he cuts it to bring to certain lumber warehouses or he takes them to Guayaquil where they give him a very good price. He also takes his fruit there, especially Guanábana, which is what he sells the most. 
  
This loan is for his husband to buy bamboo and fruit to contniue with his business. She has been in the communal bank for 2 years and she likes it because the loans are quick and don't have so many requirements. 

Her dream is to have a truck to transport her products.

loans.use: to buy bamboo and fruit

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: El Señor Mario Habitante del Municipio de Ticuantepe labora como cadete de una Moto taxi, su mayor sueño es tener mejores condiciones de vida y mejorar su casa, su mas grande dificultad es que se le hace muy dificil recaudar todo el dinero ya que siempre surgen gastos en le hogar. Con este financiamiento que se le esta otorgando a Mario podra cumplir parte de su sueño ya que comprar Materiales para empezar a construir. Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Zinc, el espera contar siempre con el apoyo de Afodenic y de Fondos Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Mario lives in the town of Ticuantepe and works as a motorcycle taxi driver. His greatest wish is to have better living conditions and to make improvements to his house. Mario’s greatest challenge is being able to raise all of the money that is required to take care of the constant household expenses.

With the loan being provided, Mario will be able to fulfill part of his dream. He will buy building materials such as blocks, cement, sand, and zinc so that the work can begin. Mario hopes to always have the support of AFODENIC and Kiva funds.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, and zinc.

loans.name: Teresa Leonor

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es maestro en construcción.

Ella en sociedad con uno de sus hijos tiene un restaurante en su casa, allí todos los días preparan deliciosos almuerzos y meriendas, dia a dia llegan muchas personas hasta su establecimiento a servirse sus deliciosos platos, ya son siete años que llevan con este negocio el cual lo emprendieron con uno de los créditos que recibieron del banco por lo cual ella está muy agradecida ya que es así como han salido adelante, ya que el trabajo de su esposo no es seguro y  habido temporadas largas que él no tiene trabajo y gracias a su negocio han podido salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  10 años y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Mujeres Unidas (United Women), meets every fifteen days in Cantón Jipijapa. The region, also known by the name Sultana del Café, is known for its extensive cultivation of a distinctly flavored coffee, its local cuisine, and the warmth of its people. 

In this location, lives Teresa.  She is 65 years old, married, and has four children from this marriage.  [These children] have reached the age of adulthood, but one of them still lives with Teresa.  Her husband is a master stonemason. 

Teresa, in partnership with one of her children, has a restaurant [that is operated] in her house.  Each day, they prepare delicious lunches and snacks there.  From day to day, large numbers of [customers] arrive at her establishment to be served her delicious dishes.  It has been seven years that they have operated this business, a business that they started with a loan that they received from the bank.  For this, Teresa is very appreciative since [the credit] has [allowed her family] to progress. The [availability of] work for her husband is unpredictable and there have been long periods of time that he did not have work.  Thanks to her business, they have been able to move forward [in a positive direction].  

Teresa will use this loan to purchase rice, meat, fish and other food supplies used in the preparation of the meals.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 10 years and likes [being a member] since it was thanks to one the loans that she started her business.  

Her goals are to continue advancing her business and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, fish, and other food supplies.

loans.name: Victoria Fabiana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Victoria, tiene 50 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvieron cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes.

Ella se dedica al negocio de la panadería negocio que tiene desde que estaba vivo su querido esposo, luego de la muerte de el ella tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio con la ayuda de sus hijos quienes trabajan para ella, tiene un local en su casa y otro en el centro de la ciudad, ellos trabaja desde las 5h00 horneando  el pan para que cuando sus clientes lleguen puedan llevar el mejor y más delicioso pan a sus mesas, uno de sus hijos también se encarga de ir por los campos vendiendo en una moto de su propiedad, en estos lugares se vende mucho sus productos lo cual les deja muy buenas ganancias. Lleva más de 20 años en este negocio
.
Este crédito es para  comprar harina, azúcar, manteca y otros ingredientes más que se utilizan en la preparación del pan. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton, known as the "Sultan of Coffee" because of its extensive fields of coffee of incomparable flavor,  its gastronomy and the quality of its people.

Victoria, 50, lives here.  Her husband died some years ago but they had four children who are now all adults and independent.
She has a bakery which she had when her dear husband was alive.  After his death she had to take charge and did so with  the help of her children who worked with her.  She has a sales area in her house and another in the city center.  They start work at 5 am baking the bread so that when the customers arrive, they take the best and most delicious bread to their tables.  One of her sons is also in charge of going to the fields and selling from his motorbike.  He sells a lot of products in these areas and he makes good money.  He has been doing this for 20 years.

She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, lard and other ingredients that she uses to prepare the bread.  She has been in the communal bank for 5 years and she likes the help that she gets from the loans.

Her dream is to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, lard and other ingredients

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 14 12, 10, 7 y 1 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los dos siguientes en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, además su esposo también se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, él se desplaza por toda la ciudad vendiendo sus productos, ella tiene más de 7 años  con su negocio  y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y frutas y legumbres para el negocio del esposo.  Está en el Banco Comunal hace 7 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio que hoy le permite tener sus propios ingresos. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" ["United Women"]  meets every fifteen days in the canton of Jipijapa, a canton known as the Sultana [or Princess] of Coffee, thanks to the extensive cultivation of coffee with an incomparable flavor, as well as its gastronomy and the warmth of its people. 

In this place lives María, who is 30 years old and has a common-law husband, with whom she has five children, aged 14 12, 10, 7 and 1. The two older children are in secondary school, and the following two are in primary school. Her husband is a merchant. 
 
To get ahead together with her family, she has a store in her home. There she sells all types of products, such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, beans, green vegetables and fruits. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m., and sometimes later. In addition, her husband also works selling fruits and vegetables; he goes all around the city selling his products. Maria has more than 7 years with her business and it is going very well for her. 

She will use this loan to stock her store with more products; she will buy rice, sugar, oil, and detergents, along with fruits and vegetables for her husband's business. She has been in the communal bank for 7 years, and she likes it because with the first loan, she started her business, which today allows her to have her own income. 

Her goals are to get ahead and to give her children the best of everything.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Alejandra Eduvis

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Alejandra, tiene 76 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos ya todos  mayores de edad, la mayor vive en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene una tienda en el mercado local, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, además su esposo también tiene un puesto en el mismo mercado de venta de frutas y legumbres,  allí trabajan juntos todos los días ya que el negocio de su esposo esta en las afueras de su tienda, por lo cual cuando requieren de la ayuda el otro está para ayudarse mutuamente,  lleva más de 12 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para surtir más su tienda y frutas y legumbres para el negocio de su esposo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace más de 16 años y le gusta porque gracias al crédito instalo su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Unidas (Women United) meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton, a canton known as the sultan of coffee because of its extensive plantings of coffee, which has an incomparable flavor, as well as for its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Señora Alejandra, who is 76 years old, lives in this place. She is married, and from this relationship she has seven children, all of whom are adults. The oldest lives in her house. Her husband is a businessman.

She has a store in the local market. There she sells all types of basic products. In addition, her husband also has a fruit and vegetable stall in the same market. There they work together every day, since her husband's business is located outside of her store, so that when one needs help, the other is there for mutual assistance. She has had this business for more than 12 years, and it is going very well for her.

She is going to invest this loan in the purchase of groceries to further stock her store and fruits and vegetables for her husband's business. She has been in the communal bank since its beginning more than 16 years ago, and she likes it because she set up her business thanks to the loan.

Her goals are to continue forward and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy groceries, fruits, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
This is Merlyn, 42 years old and resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Freddie and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Merlyn operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trapping. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials, like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business.  She also want to get a new sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merlyn hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fabric, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma.teresa

texts.en:
Ma.Teresa is 45 years old and is married to Eugenio, a father who manages their farm production.  

Ma.Teresa is engaged in hog-raising business. She has been in her business for more than three years. She usually earns about PHP 7,500 every time she disposes of it. 

Ma.Teresa wants to have more hogs to raise, but she lacks the necessary capital. To make it possible, Ma. Teresa is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccine, and additional hogs to raise. 

She hopes to maintain her business for the future of her family. She will manage her business well and gain higher income to save some of it for their future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Li

texts.en:
This is Li.  She is 55 years old and a resident living from Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh.  She is married to Lors, her husband and a father of four grown-up children. 

Li and her husband are working hard in a retail business to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  As usual, they retail dried fish at mobile markets and generate an average income of 8 USD per each. They have been operating this business for over 10 years. Li thanks to her frequent customers who love eating her dried fish.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 1,500 USD to purchase more dried fish to expand her inventory for a constant sale. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Also with a portion of the loan, she will use to renovate broken parts of her present house to better their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El productor Julio de 62 años de edad, habita en la Colonia Nuevo Leon, se dedica a la Ganaderia y a la Agricultura, de donde obtiene sus ingresos para mantener su familia, por lo que este señor se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable, culta y de buenas costumbres.

Agradece a Kiva por el apoyo brindado en el credito anterior que lo aprovecho en el establecimiento de pasto esto le ayudo a mejorar sus condiciones alimenticia a su hato ganadero donde obtuvo buena ganancia por haber requerido el peso necesario en menor tiempo; y quiere cotinuar trabjando con creditos.

Esta vez solicita financiamiento para Cultivar 2 mzs del cultivo de yuca para obtener mayores ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.

Desea ver a su familia unida, y con abundante salud.
texts.en:
Farmer Julio is 62 years old. He lives in the Nuevo Leon settlement. He works in livestock raising and agriculture, from which he obtains his income to maintain his family, and for this reason this man is characterized by being a responsible, cultured and decent person.

He is grateful to Kiva for the support offered through his last loan, which he made use of to establish his pastureland. This helped him improve the feeding conditions for his livestock, from which he obtained good earnings because they reached the necessary weight in less time. He wants to continue working with loans.

This time is is applying for a loan to grow two manzanas (about 3.5 acres) of yucca to obtain more income and thus to improve his quality of life.

He wants to see his family united and in full health.

loans.use: to grow yucca.

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Adjoavi âgée de 42ans est veuve. Elle supporte seule ses deux enfants qui sont âgés de 25 et 15ans. En 1990, elle vend dans un marché de la ville des articles plastiques et des ustensiles de cuisine. Les demandes ne cessent d’accroitre et elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire les clients  à cause de l’insuffisance du capital. Elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit pour acheter des marchandises (articles plastiques et des ustensiles de cuisine) à Lomé. Avec les profits réalisés,elle souhaiterait agrandir le stock et assurer une condition de vie meilleure à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjoavi is a 42-year-old widow.  She, alone, provides for her two children, ages 25 and 15.  

In 1990, she started to sell plastic ware and kitchen utensils at a local market in town.  Customer demand has never stopped to increase, and Adjoavi cannot satisfy all of her customers' needs because her capital is too small.

She is requesting a second loan from WAGES, which will be used to buy some merchandise in Lomé (plastic ware and kitchen utensils).

With her expected profits, she would like to expand her inventory and provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy plastic ware and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Girumugisha Group

texts.fr:
Amélie fait partie du groupe Girumugiha  et   habite à Gitega. Elle a   45 ans et est mariée à Fulgence, un menuisier. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants, dont 5 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de bananes   depuis 10 ans. 

Elle est à son  quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Grâce au profit de son commerce, elle a acheté une parcelle et paie les frais de scolarité des enfants  et assure les soins de santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Amélie is a member of the Girumugisha group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 45 years old and married to Fulgence, a carpenter.  Amélie and Fulgence have six children, five of whom attend school.

Amélie has been selling bananas for the past ten years.

This is her fourth loan with Turame.  With her loan from Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale, so that she can make more money.

With the profits from her business, she has bought a plot of land.  She also pays for her children's school fees and covers her family's healthcare costs.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia dreams of lifting her family out of poverty. She is 57 years old. She operates a small store in front of their house where she sells a variety of products. She has been in this business for 3 years and usually earns 200 a day which is used for food and allowances. Olivia’s business needs additional products to sell in order to increase profits. Therefore, she is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, bread, sugar, coffee and beverages.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, bread, sugar, coffee and beverages.

loans.name: Sate

texts.fr: Jeune célibataire de 27ans, Sate est aviculteur de profession. Il est dans ce domaine il y a 02ans et le fait à domicile. Il est aidé par 02 personnes. Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite dans notre institution un premier prêt pour acheter de la provende pour alimenter les pondeuses. Avec les profits, il souhaiterait créer une autre structure d’élevage et plus tard se lancer dans la vie maritale.
texts.en:
Sate, age 27, is single and professionally involved in poultry farming.  He has been working in this field for two years, from home.  Two people help him with his business.

In order to bolster his business, he is requesting a first loan from our institution.  This loan will be used to buy poultry feed for his laying hens.

With his profits, he would like to build a second poultry farm, and later on, to get married.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed for his laying hens.

loans.name: Maribelle

texts.en: Maribelle aims to become successful and financially stable to give her family a better life. She is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. As a way of gaining income, she is engaged in selling motorcycle parts while her husband manages their farmland. They planned to improve their business and educate their children so that they will have a bright future someday. To improve the business, Maribelle is asking for additional capital of P20,000.00 to buy more stock of motorcycle parts like tires, sprockets, bearings, tubes, spark plugs, brake shoes and connecting rods to sell. She believes that through this financial assistance, she will make an improvement in the business as she continues to work and strive for it.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts like tires, sprockets, bearings, tubes, spark plugs, brake shoes and connecting rods to sell

loans.name: Kwale Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who still go to school. She has been running two business, a grocery store and a game station, for five years now. She works from 5pm to 12pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.
She is requesting her 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a freezer for the grocery business, two TVs, and DVDs for the game station and she has paid back all her loans successfully.
She hopes to receive the loan which she will use to buy stock for her new food shop. Her dream is to one day be able to own a car.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kwale" which totals 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her new food shop business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 59, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She lives with Carlos, who works abroad. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. 

Elvira hopes to grow her business through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is a responsible mother who gives support to her husband in cultivating their farmland by planting vegetables and pineapples for sale. They aim to have a fruitful harvest to earn sufficient income to satisfy their necessities and continue sending their five children to college. In this regard, they planned to expand their vegetables and pineapple plantation to increase their yields but due to inadequate capital, Celia is asking for an additional P25,000 to be used in buying fertilizers and pesticides needed for the maintenance of their crops. They believe that this loan will enable them to expand their plantation and increase their production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for the maintenance of her pineapple production

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is a farmer who owns and manages a rice farming business in his community. He is now 55 years old and has four grown-up children. Due to hardships of life, he aims to increase the crop's yield and his income to cover his expenses and save some money for future emergencies. 
He has been a farmer for almost 20 years and usually earns a profit of 22000 PHP in every harvest season. His income is usually spent on food, clothing, transportation and other household expenses.
To improve his farming business, Nestor is asking for additional capital of 25000 PHP, which will be used to buy fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of his crop.
He hopes that he will have a high yield this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of his crop.

location.town: Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Blest

texts.en:
This is Blest, 61, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Isaias who is a business man, and she is a mother to their children. At this time, Blest is working hard to meet the financial expenses of her family as well as their other everyday expenses at home.

Blest sells charcoal. She gets large quantities and then packs them into smaller plastic containers to sell to the community. She also sells coconut for another source of income. She earns a minimum of Php200 a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Blest is requesting a Php8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of ready-to-wear clothes with different designs, shapes and sizes, as well as charcoal. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Blest dreams to be able to expand her business and be prepared when the time comes that she will have her own family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Minda

texts.en: Minda is a hog-raiser. She lives in the village where she works. Minda is 47 years old and is married to Tomas. She has been running her business for more than six years. Minda earns about PHP 2,500 per piglet she sells. Right now, Minda is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 9,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs

loans.name: Huruma Group

texts.en:
Lena, aged 47, is single, with two children who still go to school. She has been selling dagaa (a kind of small, dried fish) for two years now. She works from 6am to 6pm daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit. 
This will be Lena's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy more stocks of dagaa. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Huruma", with 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dagaa

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 49 years old and is blessed with four grown children. They live happily in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. They aimed to upgrade their status of living to support the education of their children and give a better life. Due to financial difficulty, Emily engages in buying and selling of frozen foods in their community to earn additional income. She aimed to strengthen her business and make it a viable source of income but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional of 15,000 PHP to buy more stocks of frozen foods like longaniza (pork sausages), hot dogs, tocino (sweet cured pork) and fish to sell in their village. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of longaniza (pork sausage), hot dogs, tocino and fish to sell

loans.name: Marvener

texts.en: Marvener is 29 years of age, married and has three children. He owns and manages an Aircon Repair Shop business in their community. This is his way of generating additional income for his family. Since he has no competitors in the area, he aims to continue and strengthen the business to increase his income. Due to financial difficulty, Marvener is asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy FREON R13 1/A, Silver rod, aluminum rod, filter drier and washing machine parts needed in repairing air conditioners and other appliances. He believes that this financial assistance will help a lot to improve the business and make it viable in the future.

loans.use: to buy FREON R13 1/A, silver rod, aluminum rod, filter drier and washing machine parts needed in the repair shop

location.town: Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Srey Mom is 26 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a workman who earns about $10 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey Mom is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase groceries to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her store and send her child to school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Mwinyi Group

texts.en:
Yusuph, who is in his early 30s, is married with two children who go to school. He has been a tailor and has been selling clothes material for ten years now. He works from 8am to 7pm daily and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

He is requesting his 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more clothes material and he has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy more clothes material and a tailoring machine. His dream is to one day be able to open a tailoring company to provide employment opportunities for the youth.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mwinyi" which totals 13 members. The members of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes material and a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Sennie

texts.en:
Sennie is 41 years old and lives in Jacobs Town. She has six children, aged 10 to 22, who are attending school.
