For four years now, she has been selling peppers, rice, oil and other items. She started this business after she graduated from high school, and she graduate at the age 37 because her parent did not had the financial support to send her to school, she said that she grew up in the rural area and started school late. Her current challenge is to keep the business up and running while taking care of her children. What she likes about the business is making her own money to support her children and pay her own expenses.

Sennie has requested a loan to purchase rice, peppers, oil and others items for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, peppers, oil and other items for her business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret, 27, lives in Jacob town with her husband and three children, aged 4,6,and 8. Her husband is a businessman. For the past two years, she has been selling rice on a retail basis in the market. She received the initial capital from her husband to start this business. She makes a profit when she sells; with the profit, she buy more goods and helps with the household expenses. 

 She has requested this loan to purchase more bags of rice for the business. Her dream for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for the business.

loans.name: Tinme

texts.en:
Tinme lives in Jacobs Town. She is 28 years old and married, and her husband is a principal. They have two children, age 6 and 2 years old.

For the past 3 years she has been running a shop in her community. She started this business with money from her by husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more toothpaste, rice, oil and others items for her business. Her plans is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more toothpaste, rice, oil and others items for her business.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Hamisi, age 33, is married with one child, who is still young. 

He has been running a retail shop selling clothes, soaps, and cosmetics of different kinds for six years now. He works from 7 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily, and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his business stock, to pay household expenses, and to buy a bicycle, a mattress, and a radio.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.

He hopes for a loan to restock items in his retail shop. His dream is to one day be able to expand his business.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Juhudi" with 18 members who will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock items in his retail shop.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 32 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a carpenter. They have five children, aged 9 to 17, three of whom live at home and attend school.

Hawa has been selling charcoal for the past five years. She was taught how to run the business by a mother.  Her main challenge is the increases in prices for the coal bags. She is happy when she sells and makes more profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She would like to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en:
Tawah, aged 45, is a widow who lives at Congo Town with her three children, aged between 15 and 23. She has been working very hard to manage her business and to attend to her children's needs. For the past 15 years, Tawah has been selling steel nails, door locks, painting brushes, etc. She learned how to sell from her mother. What she loves most about her business is the amount of income that she generates per day. With the profit, Tawah buys more goods to improve her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more door locks, steel nails, paint brushes, etc. to sell. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase door locks, steel nails, paint brushes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Beatric

texts.en:
Beatric is 30 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She finished her education at junior high level. She has two children aged seven and nine, both of whom attend school and live at home.

Beatric is engaged in selling fresh fish at the local market. She makes more profit during the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish to sell. Beatric plans to build a house for her children and to marry a decent man in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Eliasi, who is in his early 30s, is single with one child, who still goes to school.

He has been running two businesses, selling chips and selling groceries for five years now.  He works from 2 p.m. to 11 p.m. daily, and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle for his business, to buy a DVD, and to increase his business stock. He has paid back all his loans successfully.

He wants a loan to use to buy a plot of land which he expect to build his own house.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house and to expand his business.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Unity," which has 17 members, who hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to build his own house.

loans.name: Cecilla

texts.en:
This is Cecilla. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help toward the education of her children and in her family's personal, household and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Cecilla dreams of growing her business and securing her future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mar

texts.en: Mar is a responsible father who operates a motorcycle transport in his village to generate additional income. He is 36 years old, married and has three school-age children. His ambition in life is to improve their living condition and give his family a better life. He planned to continue and strengthen the business to increase his income but due to inadequate capital, Mar is asking for an additional of PHP 10,000 to buy oil, gasoline, tires, spark plugs and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He hopes that he can able to earn a higher income as he continues to use daily his motorcycle transport for passenger's use.

loans.use: to buy oil, gasoline, tires, spark plugs and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Aisalkyn

texts.ru:
Айсалкын 41 год, замужем, воспитывает 2 дочерей. Айсалкын в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  10 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Айсалкын в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 головы крупного рогатого скота с приплодом, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айсалкын обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Айсалкын планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, посредством которого она будет оплачивать обучение дочерей в медицинском колледже.
texts.en:
Aisalkyn is 41 years old, married, and raising 2 daughters. As the main source of income for her family, Aisalkyn has been raising cattle and growing crops for the past 10 years, having started her business with a sum of 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Aisalkyn's farm currently includes 2 cows with offspring, while her monthly profits from her business total approximately 8,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Aisalkyn has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase cattle for fattening and resale. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business, through which she will pay for her daughters' education in a medical college.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Rysbubu

texts.ru:
Рысбубу 45 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Рысбубу в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  13 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 6,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Рысбубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 головы крупного рогатого скота с приплодом, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рысбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Рысбубу планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, а в будущем планирует помочь сыну в постройке дома.
texts.en:
Rysbubu is 45 years old, married, and raising 3 children. As the main source of income for her family, Rysbubu has been farming and raising livestock for the past 13 years, having started her business with a sum of 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Rysbubu's farm currently includes 2 cows with offspring, while her monthly profits total roughly 5,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Rysbubu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase cattle for fattening and resale. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business, and in the future would like to help her son build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening and resale

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбубе 39 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Детям 14, 17 и 19 лет. Она очень хорошо училась в школе и университете. После окончания университета она работала в больнице. Махбуба вышла замуж и у нее появились финансовые проблемы, так как ее муж не мог обеспечить семью. Махбуба обеспечивает детей одна, данное время ее муж работает в России и не может обеспечить семью с необходимыми средствами.  Ее второй сын поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет, факультет Финансы и кредит. Махбуба не в состоянии оплатить за учебу сына в университете. Она запрашивает кредит и надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is 39 years old. She is married and raising three children 14, 17 and 19 years of age. Mahbuba was a very good student in school and university, and then worked in a hospital. After getting married, Mahbuba's financial problems began as her husband was unable to provide for the family. Presently, Mahbuba looks after her children alone, while her husband works in Russia and cannot support the family. 

Mahbuba's second son has just entered the Tajik State University's faculty of Finance and Loans. Mahbuba is unable to pay for his education and so she is requesting this loan and hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university education

loans.name: Savon

texts.en:
Savon is 53 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in an agricultural business for more than ten years, has an extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up animals. She earns about $3 per day. Her husband sells charcoal and firewood. He earns about $10 daily. Two of her children are garment workers who earn about $10 each day. 

Savon is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase timbers to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and send her youngest child to school.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to build a new house.

loans.name: Ma.theresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Theresa, 44, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Larry, a driver, the father of her children. Together with her husband, she works hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Theresa maintains a direct catering business. When most people refer to a "caterer", they are referring to an event caterer who serves food with waiting staff at dining tables or sets up a self-serve buffet. The food may be prepared on site, i.e., made completely at the event, or the caterer may choose to bring prepared food and put the finishing touches on it once it arrives.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Theresa dreams of being able to expand her catering business soon so as to serve more people. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Vuthy is 44 years old. He is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a soldier who earns about $3 per day. His wife (who is with him in the picture) sells vegetables. She earns about $5 daily. 

Vuthy is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase utensils and other materials to run an additional business selling soup. By doing so, he will earn more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and send his child to a good school. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and other materials to to run an additional business selling soup.

loans.name: Ileje Group

texts.en:
Kankela, who is in her early 40s, is single with one boy who still goes to school. She has been running a clothes business for one year now. She works from 9am to 6pm daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more clothes and paid household expenses; she has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a new loan to increase the clothes in her shop and add missing items to her two new businesses – a grocery store and a restaurant. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a plot and build her own house.

She will share loan with her loan group "Ileje" which has 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the clothes she has to sell and purchase missing items for her two other businesses.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 37 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a fortune teller who earns about $2 daily. Her husband is a construction foreman. He earns about $7 each day. 

Lida is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work. This purchase will help her husband run the business smoothly. In the future, she would like to expand his business and send her children to school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
This is Annalyn, 39, a resident of GMA, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Marcos who works as a Maintenance Officer, and she is also a mother. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annalyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Annalyn hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang is 28 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband (who joins her in the picture) is a Chinese translator who earns about $5 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Samnang is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase groceries to resell at home. By doing so, she will be able to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and send her children to school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell at home.

loans.name: Heurn

texts.en:
Heurn is 46 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening-up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband (who joins her in the picture) sells charcoal. He earns about $7 each day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $4 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s living condition, Heurn is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a walking tractor and a trailer to use for tilling farmland and carrying charcoal to sell. This purchase will help her generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. In addition, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor and a trailer to use for tilling farmland and carrying charcoal to sell.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La is 40 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling noodles for more than three years, earning approximately $25 per day. Her husband (who joins her in the picture) is a construction worker who earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, La is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase groceries to sell. By doing so, she will be able to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her noodle store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Veurn

texts.en:
Veurn is 47 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in an agricultural business for more than ten years, has an extensive experience and is successful in her business. She is involved in growing rice and fattening-up animals. She earns about $2 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of her children are employed, one as a garment worker and the other as a phone repairer. They earn about $10 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Veurn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase phones and SIM cards to sell. By doing so, she will earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her phone shop and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase phones and SIM cards to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to start building a wall.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El Sr. Jaime de 48 años de edad, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene 2 hijos ambos realiza estudios universitarios, la casa que habita es propia. Trabaja como Conductor para la Municipalidad de Juigalpa desde hace 3 años y seis meses. Cabe mencionar que ésta es la segunda vez que solicita Fondos Kiva lo cual con el primero pudo realizar un cuarto para su hijo mayor y ahora le interesa mejorar su vivienda, lo cual necesita repello de paredes de su casa, para brindar a su familia un lugar agradable y comodo donde vivir que es su mayor anelo.
texts.en: Jaime is 48 years old and married with two children. His wife stays at home and his children are both studying at the university. He owns his own home and has worked as a driver for the municipality of Juigalpa for the last three and a half years. This is the second time that Jaime has asked for a loan from Kiva. The first one was used to build a room for his oldest son and now he would like a loan to make additional home improvements. Jaime would like to plaster the walls of his house in order to provide a more comfortable and pleasant home for his family - that's his greatest desire.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
Cheam is 42-year-old mother who is engaged in a hog-raising business as her supplementary business in addition to rice farming. She raises pigs for slaughter in her village, Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She has two children, one of whom is already married and works as a construction foreman while the other child is still dependent and attending school. Despite her hardship, Cheam would like to attain a better quality of life and provide a good education to her youngest child.

Due to the lack of a vehicle in her household, Cheam and her spouse have encountered difficulties in their transportation needs and they have to pay for transportation when they wish to go anywhere. As a result, Cheam is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorcycle for home use. She hopes to provide good living conditions for her family someday.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for home use.

loans.name: Wome Development Group

texts.en:
WOME (Women of Mawokota Entrepreneurs) is found in a small trading centre within Mpigi town. It’s a group composed of many hardworking women, mostly engaged in retail trade and agriculture. They fall into the categories of divorcees, widows, single mothers and few married women.

Namubiru(Kanzaali) is a married woman with three children and three grandsons. She has managed to see her elder son through school and is still struggling with the rest. Hajala is a food vendor; she operates a local restaurant and supplements it with small-scale agriculture. She resorted to food vending way back in 1992 as means to acquire some money to pay her children and grandchildren’s school fees after they were neglected by their reckless father. 

Hajala intends to use the money to buy more plastic seats for the restaurant and three bigger saucepans. She will use the balance to stock additional foodstuffs. Her main customers are students from the nearby Mpigi Light College, Bboza residents and a few passersby. 

Hajala’s main challenges include fluctuating prices for the food stuffs, bad debtors and a non-conducive working environment which is worsened by too much dust. Despite all the challenges Hajala has still endured as she is resilient, committed and determined to change her future and that of her family. Her dream is to build her own residential house in the trading centre to reduce costs of renting and also earn money through rental income.

loans.use: To buy plastic seats, saucepans and food stuffs such as sweet potatoes, beans and maize.

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora. Julia es socia del banco comunal El Arenal al cual pertenece hace tres años y medio, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es de clima frió, desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

La Señora Julia tiene 35 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 12, 11 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeras hijas estudian en colegio y en escuela. Su esposo es artesano, la casa en la que viven es arrendada.

Ella nos comenta que por el momento está bien de salud al igual que están todos los miembros de su familia por lo que le agradece a Dios.

La Señora Julia labora en un taller de tapicería desde que se caso ya que su esposo tenía el taller desde que era soltero y ahora es un negocio familiar, negocio que le permite pasar en casa al cuidado de su familia.

Todos los créditos anteriores le han permitido aportar para crecer en el negocio de la familia. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos y cuero para su negocio. En el pago de su ultimo crédito se atrasado un poco porque el negocio ha estado un poco bajo pero ya realizo la cancelación total del crédito. 

La banca comunal le gusta porque hay un gran compañerismo y los créditos le permiten solventar los gastos de su negocio. 
Su sueño es  seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia has been a member of community bank El Arenal for three and a half years. She lives in Cuenca, a city with a cold climate that was designated a World Heritage site in December of 1999. The people of Cuenca continue to maintain their culture and traditions. 

Julia is 35 years old, married and she and her husband have three children ages 12, 11 and 1 year old. Her oldest daughters are in school. Her husband is an artesan. They rent their home. Julia tells us that she is in good health at the moment, as are all the members of her family and she is grateful to God for this. 

Julia works in an upholstery shop that belonged to her husband when he was single and is now a family business. The business allows her to be at home to take care of her family. All of her previous loans were used to grow the family business. The new loan will be used to buy fabric, thread and leather for the business. She likes the communal bank for it's camaraderie and because the loans allow her to cover all the costs of her business. Her dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and leather for her upholstery business.

loans.name: Lorm

texts.en:
Lorm, aged 31, is an industrious woman who pays full attention to her farming business as well as her hog-raising business. In the rainy season time, she devotes most her time to working in the rice fields, where she particularly grows and harvests rice to sell for profit. Together with her spouse she manages their household while operating the business. In the dry season, Lorm turns to hog-raising as her focused business and takes good care of her piglets so she is able to quickly sell them within 3 to 4 months. Her generated income is used for her daily expenses, including food and allowances for her three school-aged children.

Lorm would like to acquire a loan through HKL to purchase feeds and additional piglets for fattening. Also, she will use a portion of the loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her rice crops. Lorm anticipates having better yields as a result of this investment. She also dreams that her children will have a good education and financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, additional piglets for fattening, fertilizers, and pesticides for her rice crops.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
This is Susana, 49, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Juan, and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susana operates a buy and sell business. She buys gold scraps and old notes then sells them to collectors. She also buys and sells jewelry. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Susana dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education and hopes to expand her business through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gold scraps and jewelry needed in her business.

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Agatha, who is in her early 20s, is married with a young baby. She is currently employed in a restaurant but she has been selling soaps and juices for four months now. She works every evening after work; she runs her business in nearby cafes and shops as she doesn't have her own place and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy sacks of charcoal and she has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to start a new grocery business and to buy stocks of groceries. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mavuno" which has 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of groceries.

loans.name: Ferdos

texts.en: After repaying the first loan successfully, Ferdos has applied for another loan. She has now started to tailor curtains using the sewing machine she has, that is, in addition to selling clothes and blankets. Having a good demand for the curtains that she makes has led Ferdos to apply for another loan to buy materials and a bigger sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy materials and a bigger sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es un miembro activo del banco comunal Bankito Progresista en el cual se encuentra hace 3 años, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca hace 5 años ya que es oriunda de la ciudad de Riobamba en donde se dedicaba al trabajo del campo pero para mejorar la economía de su hogar, se arriesgado a vivir en otra ciudad lejos de su familia y así sacar en adelante su hogar.
 
Ella tiene 49 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 18 años de edad que  trabaja y ayuda económicamente. Su esposo se dedica al comercio de varios productos o de temporada, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa desde que llego a la ciudad se dedica al comercio, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de gafas para el sol y varios accesorios más, pero hace un año se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada que vende ambulantemente, esta actividad le da la oportunidad de mejorar la economía de su hogar.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para tener una mayor variedad.
 
Su meta es comprarse un terreno en la ciudad para construir su casita.
texts.en:
Rosa is an active member of the communal bank Bankito Progresista, which she has belonged to for 3 years. She has lived in Cuenca for 5 years and is originally from the city of Riobamba. She worked on a farm there but in order to improve her economic situation she has taken the risk of moving to another city, far from her family, in order to help them get ahead. 

Rosa is 49 years old, married and has an 18 year old son who works and helps the family financially.  Her husband works selling various seasonal products. They don't own a home so he lives in a rental. 

Since she arrived to Cuenca, Rosa has worked as a street vendor. She used to sell sunglasses and other accessories but a year ago she began selling seasonal fruit. This line of work gives her the opportunity to improve her family's financial situation. Rosa will use the loan to buy fruit in order to offer a greater variety to her customers. Her goal is to buy a piece of land in the city and build a small house.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is 50 years of age and a single mother of five adult children, three of whom are single and two are married. To earn a living, Kong farms rice on her existing farmland, located in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She earns 8,000 KHR each day to support her family. She has been carrying out this business for over 30 years. 

As it is tiring work, Kong would like to hire a few laborers for the maintenance of the rice field. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 500,000 KHR to pay for labor costs. Through patience and hard work, Kong hopes to receive a better harvest in the coming season. In the future, she plans to expand her rice farming and to increase her annual production.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs to maintain her rice field.

loans.name: Ekhlas

texts.en:
Ekhlas is 43 years old. She is the mother of six boys and one girl. They live in the eastern part of Amman. To help her husband in improving their living conditions, she started making detergents and other cleaning products in a special section in her house. She sells her products to neighbors and other markets in the neighborhood. 

She wants to expand her area of production, so she applied for this loan to purchase some materials to increase her productivity and be able to provide additional mini-markets with her products.

loans.use: to purchase some materials to increase her productivity.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 33-year-old married woman. She has a small home-based business selling clothes to friends, neighbors and relatives. She buys the clothes at a whole sale market and sometimes from a free zone area to make more profit. 

Now she has applied for this loan to increase the quantity of clothes she has in preparation for the holiday season and for the upcoming autumn season.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothes she has.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 40-year-old conservative housewife; she has asked her husband Jamal to take her place in the photo. 

Jamal is supporting a family of seven members with the income he makes from his business, cleaning services. In order to support her husband, Iman has decided to take out this loan so that they can buy their partner's share of the business. This will allow them to own the business themselves.

loans.use: to buy their partner’s share of the business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single guy, who is a university student majoring in physics at a government university. 

Mohammad has applied for this loan to pay his semester fees. He is seeking a BA degree in physics and hopes that he can find a job after graduation in the same field.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She sells some homeware products from home. Bushra also sells handmade accessories that she makes herself. She has applied for this loan to buy new tools and materials such as beads to make more accessories in the hope of opening her own accessories shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tools and materials such as beads to make more accessories

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: After repaying his first loan that helped him to pay the semester fees, Amer is applying for another loan to continue paying the university fees so he can complete his BA degree now that he is in his second year.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Ekhlas

texts.en: Ekhlas is a 29-year-old housewife. Her husband serves in the military and they have no kids. She is known for her pickles; whoever comes to her house and tastes them suggests that she open a business. So, after studying and checking her opportunities, she started making a few types of pickles in medium-sized containers to sell, in addition to preparing special orders. She hopes that she can cover a larger area and even provide the food market and restaurant in the neighborhood with her pickles. But first she has applied for this loan to increase her productivity and buy more containers in different sizes.

loans.use: to buy more food containers in different sizes.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a conservative young woman so she has asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

She is a 22-year-old mother of one daughter. Her husband works in two jobs in order to improve their living conditions and provide their daughter with a suitable environment in which to grow. Malak also is taking part in this process by making and selling cheese and milk. She has several goats but she needs to increase the number she has so she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university registration fees.

loans.name: Wa'ed

texts.en: Wa’ed is a 20-year-old married woman who is also a university student majoring in hospital management. She has applied for this loan to pay her semester fees in order to get her BA degree.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa is a 21-year-old single man who is a university student majoring in management. He lives with his family but he wanted to pay for his studies without depending on his parents or brothers. Issa has therefore applied for this loan to pay  his semester fees. He hopes to continue his studies to get a Masters degree in the future.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 54-year-old married man who owns a mini market that serves the neighborhood. He also has a small truck that he uses to sell fruits and vegetables around the area. Jamal wants to expand his mini market to include a fruit and vegetable stall to attract more customers so he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add a fruit and vegetable stall to his store

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a conservative married woman so she asked her sister to take her place in the photo.

Iman, who is the mother of two children, helps to support her family by selling makeup and cosmetic products and some Russian gold and accessories. She has applied for this loan to buy more accessories and makeup products to sell so she can increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more accessories and makeup products to sell

loans.name: Samah

texts.en: Samah is an 18-year-old single woman who lives with her family which has six members. She started a small business at home selling baby diapers. Samah now wants to add more products to increase variety and her profits so she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to add more products

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng happily lives with her family which consists of three members - her spouse and two dependent children. She is a proud 28-year-old farmer who has owned and managed her farming business for almost five years. At the moment, she spends most of her day at the rice field to maintain her farm, working tirelessly with her supportive husband. Both of her children also usually work and provide her motivation in this business when they are available from school. Heng grows beans, corn, sesame, and potatoes besides the rice crop, according to the season and the market price. 
 
Heng would like to request a loan of 2,000,000 KHR due to the financial difficulty they are currently experiencing. She will use her requested loan to buy farming supplies to start growing a bean crop. Heng hopes that she can maintain a high level of production and make her business more viable through the help of the loan thus easing her hardship. She dreams of attaining her goal of meeting her family's needs and educating both of her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to start growing a bean crop.

loans.name: Suad

texts.en: Suad is a 55-year-old widow supporting a son and a daughter. She works in a private commercial bank in the cleaning service department. She has a small business at home selling clothes and cosmetic products to add another source of income so she can support her family. She applied for this loan to increase the amount of clothes and products she has to increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase the amount of clothes she has to sell.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chun is 32 years old and is married to Try. This couple has been blessed with a lovely young child who is currently attending the local school in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Chun, being a responsible man and the head of his family, tries to work hard to provide his household with happiness and financial stability. He is employed as an administrative officer for a local company, earning approximately 10 USD per day while his wife operates a crop growing business on their existing farmland.

Since the family doesn’t own a vehicle for commuting and transporting things, they are experiencing difficulties in meeting their transportation needs. They have to contribute a portion of their income to pay for daily transportation costs to get to work or to anywhere else. For this reason, Chun is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase a motorcycle for personal and household use. He knows that this loan will help them to be more productive which will improve his ability to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for personal and household use.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: LA SRA. OFELIA TIENE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES UNA MUJER CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS. DESDE HACE 10 AÑOS SE DEDICA A ATENDER SU NEGOCIO DE ABARROTES, EL CUAL TIENE UBICADO EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO. GRACIAS A SU NEGOCIO ELLA PUEDE APOYAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DE SU FAMILIA Y JUNTOS HAN COMENZADO A AMPLIAR UN POCO SU CASA PARA PODER TENER MAYOR COMIDAD EN SU HOGAR Y TAMBIEN EN EL NEGOCIO DE ELLA. POR ESTA RAZON LA SRA. OFELIA SOLICITA UN CREDITO CON EL CUAL REALIZARA UNA COMPRA DE MERCANCIA MAYOR PARA PODER OFRECER MAS VARIEDAD A SUS CLIENTES Y PODER ASI CONSEGUIR AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS CON LOS CUALES DESEA POCO A POCO PODER TERMINAR ALGUNOS DETALLES DE LA REMODELACIO DE SU CASA.
texts.en: Ofelia, 43, is married and has two children.  She’s been managing her grocery store for the last ten years.  It’s located at home.  Thanks to her business she’s able to help her husband with family expenses and together they’ve gradually been enlarging their house to have more comfort at home and also in her store.  Because of this Ofelia is asking for a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale to offer more variety to her customers thus attaining increased income she will use to gradually finish the last remodeling jobs on her house.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao has six adult children, all of whom have had to quit studying due to the family’s financial constraints. Three of her children are already married while the other three are still single and are employed in various jobs. Mao is 55 years of age and is married to Leok, a hard-working farmer. She helps her husband in managing their rice farming business to produce a better yield. She always wishes to earn a higher income from this business. Mao is thankful that despite her age, she still has the strength to do her farming activities. At the same time, she also runs a small general store located adjacent to her house to earn additional income.

As she would like to have more farmland and thus increase her crop yield during each season of the year, Mao is now asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy an extra plot of farmland to expand her rice production. She hopes that the loan will have a positive impact on her farming business.

loans.use: to buy an extra plot of farmland to expand her rice production.

loans.name: Jameeleh

texts.en: Jameeleh is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother for 7 children. She has a small home-based business selling clothes and blankets to friends and neighbors. Her marketing strategy depends on the word of mouth among her customers. By showing some of the products she has, Jameeleh is seeking to get a loan to increase the amount of goods to increase her profits in the near future and get a new collection of clothes.

loans.use: to get a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Uong

texts.en:
Uong is a 24-year-old married woman who was only able to finish her elementary education due to financial difficulties at that time. A rice farming business and a few pieces of farmland were the only legacy that her parents passed on to her, and she has pursued this type of business as her primary source of income ever since. Uong is married to a humble farmer and they have a small child who is completely dependent on her care.

As rice farming is tiring work for Uong and her spouse, she really needs additional laborers to help complete her farmwork on time. She has insufficient funds now; therefore, she is asking for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to pay for labor costs. Uong hopes this loan will be granted to her to improve her crops and their lives as well. Someday, she aims to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 45 years old and a mother of five children, residing in Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. She operates a small store where she sells fast food, such as meatballs, bread, and skewers of beef with pickles to local people in her neighborhood, earning approximately 3.00 USD per day. Some of her younger children help her in this retail business while her husband and her oldest child work as car mechanics in a garage. 

Kim would like to have this loan in order to purchase tools and supplies for her husband and her son to be used in their mechanical work. This will enable them to work in their occupation effectively. In the future, they plan to have a small garage where they can provide their services to generate better income.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for her husband and her son to be used in their mechanical work.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun is 60 years old, is married, and lives with her family which consists of six members. Her oldest child is already settled for marriage while the remaining three are single and employed as paid workers, so that they can contribute their income to uplift their standard of living. Khun is in the business of cultivating rice as well as selling fish supplied by her husband, who is an operator of fishing activities along the river. Khun's business has provided a supplementary income that she can use to pay for her daily sustenance. She has been doing this for over 12 years.
 
To maintain her fishing business, Khun really needs new fishing materials to apply to the business at the right time but she has insufficient funds now. Therefore, Khun is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to purchase fishing materials. With this purchase, she believes that her fish supply will increase and she will receive better income.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Houn, aged 32, has two school-aged children and needs to pay for their daily allowances. She wants to make consistent profits for their education and also to help them earn a degree, so they might have good jobs someday. Houn is a small entrepreneur who owns a few plots of farmland where she plants rice and various kinds of seasonal crops to sell each season. Houn’s spouse helps his family with the income from his hard work in the construction field.

She wants to help her husband in his transportation needs. As they don’t have any vehicle for commuting, they have to pay for taxi service daily to go back and forth. That is why she is asking for additional capital to purchase a motorcycle for household use as well as for support in their business. This loan will help her improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for household use as well as for support in their business.

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora Julia se encuentra en el octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive por la comunidad de Paccha en Cuenca, lugar que tiene hermoso lugares llenos de naturaleza, su gente es amable de un corazón cálido, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Julia tiene 45 años, vive en unión libre a concebido 5 hijos de 27, 26, 23, 21 y 8 años de edad, dos de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, dos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y su último hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Ella labora como comerciante hace 25 años, vende todo tipo de granos tiernos, pero por el motivo de las vacaciones el negocio está un poco bajo y espera que mejore con el pasar de los días, se ha dedicado a laborar en esta actividad para aportar a la economía de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia. De repente también le llaman para lavar ropa ajena con lo cual se gana algo extra.

El crédito anterior lo invirtió para crecer en el negocio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de granos tiernos para tener una mayor variedad para sus clientes. En la cancelación de su crédito anterior no tuvo dificultad alguna por lo que realizo los pagos en las fechas indicadas.

El banco comunal le gusta porque los créditos el dan la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio al igual que en su vida ya que con las charlas de educación le permiten mejorar como persona.
texts.en:
Julia is on her 8th loan with the community bank Bankito Progresista. She lives in the community of Paccha in Cuenca, a city with a lot of beautiful places full of nature. The people of Cuenca are friendly and warm-hearted and they maintain the culture and traditions from their villages. 

Julia is 45 years old and she and her common-law husband have 5 children, ages 27, 26, 23, 21 and 8 years old. Two of her children are married and live on their own. Two of them work and help the family out economically and her youngest son is in school. Her husband works in construction, as a mason. They own their own home. 

Julia has been an entrepreneur for 25 years, selling all kinds of grains, but because of vacations her business is a little slow. She hopes it will improve soon. She started this type of work in order to contribute to the household economy and help her family get ahead. Lately she has been finding work washing other people's clothes and this has helped her earn a little extra money. 

Julia invested her previous loan in her business and will use this loan to buy grains in order to offer more variety to her customers. She likes the community bank because the loans give her the chance to grow her business and the classes help her grow as a person.

loans.use: to buy grains to sell.

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Mok, at age 62, operates a rice farming business to generate income. She has been doing this honestly for over 10 years since her husband passed away. Sometimes the family experiences financial constraints due to the high cost of commodities. As a result, her three children decided to start working in order to secure their living needs. Currently her oldest is married and lives separately. One of Mok’s children operates a transportation business at Phnom Penh, providing Tuk Tuk (motorcycle transportation) service. Unfortunately, his Tuk Tuk is old and often breaks while he is operating it, which results in an unsatisfactory profit. 

Mok would like to help her son in fixing his problems, so she is requesting a loan to buy a new Tuk Tuk for her son. They hope that this purchase will attract more customers to use his service. As they work hard and strive harder, they hope to make their businesses grow and become profitable.

loans.use: to buy a new Tuk Tuk (motorcycle) for her son.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um is married with three children who are all attending school. He is 32 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang province with his family. Um is a farmer and grows rice crops to generate his livelihood. He has been doing this for almost 17 years, yielding around 12,000 KHR each day. To supplement this income, Um’s wife works in a local garment factory where she can earn a decent salary to support their living costs.

Um would like to start up a hog-raising business but due the shortage of funds he has requested additional capital of 250 USD to purchase piglets and feed, and vegetable seeds to plant. This will be his first loan from HKL; he hopes that the loan will be approved so that he can further improve his living conditions. Um will save a portion of his earnings to pay the future costs of his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed, and vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en:
Srey Mom is 29 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a tailor who earns about $4 per day. Her husband runs a business of carrying water to sell. He earns about $6 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey Mom is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating rice. This purchase will help her run an additional business and earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 41 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who can earn about $3 each day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $6 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sok is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk threads to use for weaving more cloth and scarves (Krama) to sell. This purchase would help her earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase silk thread to use for weaving more cloth and scarves (Krama).

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Pursat province’s Kror kor district, Sokha is a 26-year-old mother of one son, who is still small. She is a rice farmer in the local area and supplements her family’s income by raising pigs in the backyard and selling grocery items to the local villagers. Her husband is a paid worker. Having been in business for four years, Sokha can earn a daily income from her current business of 23,000 KHR and is able to save about 13,000 KHR per day after expenses.

This is the first loan for Sokha with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Sokha is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR, which she wants to use to buy necessary materials to finish building her house. With this loan, she hopes to have a decent house to live in and also to have improved living conditions.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to finish building her house.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay is 33 years old. She is married and lives with her parents in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling dessert for more than three years, earning approximately $15 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 each day. In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Chhay is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase materials to use in her business. In addition, a part of this money will be used to fix her store. This money will help her expand her store and earn more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase materials to use in her business

loans.name: Maritza Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora. Maritza es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista hace 3 años, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gente aun mantiene su gastronomía típica, al igual que su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora. Maritza tiene 28 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 4 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico automotriz, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Maritza agradece a Dios ya que se encuentra muy bien de salud al igual que  toda su familia. Ella la mayor parte de su tiempo lo dedica a su familia y también vende ropa,  pero como es una mujer emprendedora y busca la manera de mejorar la economía de su hogar hace 2 meses  puso una tienda en la que labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, por el momento le va bien en sus ventas ya que cada día va aumentando su clientela.

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en el negocio de la ropa, y en la cancelación del mismo no tuvo ningún problema. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para surtir su tienda. El banco comunal le gusta porque los créditos le permiten crecer en sus actividades  económicas. 

Su meta es agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
Maritza has been a member of the communal bank Bankito Progresista for 3 years. She lives in Cuenca, the third most important city in the country. It is surrounded by 4 rivers and its people maintain their culture and traditions, including their traditional cuisine. 

Maritza is 28, married and she and her husband have three children, ages 7, 5, and 4 years old. All of them go to school in the city. Her husband is an auto mechanic. They don't have their own home so they live in a rental. 

Maritza is grateful to God for the good health that she and her family enjoy. Most of her time is spent taking care of her family but she also sells clothing. Since she's an entrepreneur and is always looking for ways to get ahead economically, she opened a store two months ago. She works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule. For now it's going well and her customer base is growing every day. 

Maritza invested her previous loan in her clothing business. This one she will use to buy food to stock in her store. She likes the communal bank because the loans help her expand her economic activity. Her goal is to expand her store as well.

loans.use: to buy food to sell in her store.

loans.name: Thoeung

texts.en:
Thoeung is 24 years old, is married, and operates a farming business from her village in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She happily lives there with her spouse and their young child. During the rainy season, she usually spends most of her day working in the rice field where she has hired laborers to help maintain her farm work. At the same time and for additional income, Thoeung is involved in raising pigs in her backyard pigsty. Earnings from these businesses enable her to provide for her family's basic needs and help to support her child's education.
 
Thoeung is now asking for a loan of 750 USD to purchase a plowing machine which will help increase her rice production. This machine will also provide her husband with good transportation for his firewood-trading business whenever he attaches it to a trailer. Thoeung hopes that through this loan, her family-owned businesses will be secure and she can achieve better crop production in this coming season.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine which will help increase her rice production.

loans.name: Vet

texts.en:
Vet, aged 23, is married with two small children. She owns and operates a rice farming business to earn a living and support her family financially. She has been a farmer for almost seven years and usually earns a profit of 6,000 KHR per day. Vet's spouse helps her to manage most of the maintenance of the rice field. He also collects palm juice from the top of the trees every day: this will be made into red palm sugar to be sold.

Vet plans to increase her crop yields and her income to satisfy their living needs and to educate their two children. But due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 600,000 KHR to buy the necessary agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and pesticides, to ensure high production. Vet believes that she will be able to increase her yields as she continues to work hard and make improvements to her business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and pesticides, to ensure high production.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Sarin is now 46 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school, while the other works at the family’s business to help earn money. Sarin and her husband are farmers who grow rice and plant cassava to support their family. They also supplement their family’s income by raising chickens. Having been in the business for twenty-six years, they are able to earn a daily income of 30,000 KHR and they manage to save about 9,000 KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Sarin with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland and she will also use a portion of it to lease a plot of farmland and buy cassava seedlings. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her cassava plantation and also grow her crops healthily to earn more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sophy is 28 years old and married. She has three dependent children, one daughter and two sons, who are still in school. The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and cassava planting. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for thirteen years, she can earn about 34,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 12,000 KHR each day after the expenses. The main challenge for her family’s business is the drop of cassava’s price and unhealthy rice crops. 

Sophy has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already, and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve their financial burden. Now applying for another loan of 1,500,000 KHR, she is going to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to make more healthy rice and cassava so as to increase her family’s income to improve her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Samoeun's Group

texts.en:
Samoeun, 30, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. All of her children are dependent on her and two of them are still in school, while the others are still small. Samoeun has struggled to feed and care for her children by farming rice on two hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for 13 years. Her husband is a soldier and a tricycle motor taxi driver. Together, they can earn about 25,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day for the future. 

Samoeun’s and her fellow group member have been members of VisionFund for three loan cycles already and they completely paid back their previous loans. Samoeun wisely and successfully used the loans from VisionFund to relieve her family’s financial burden and to buy some basic household necessities for the family. As the leader of the group, she is helping her group to apply for another loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to grow her rice healthily, to make a living better, and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sokem

texts.en:
Sokem, 33, is a widow who lives with her child in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She earns a living by embroidering cloth and laundering clothes. Sokem has been in this business for five years, earning about US $27 per day and she is able to save about US $9 each day after expenses. The main challenge for her business is to transport her embroidered products to customers in Phnom Penh city, which is far away from her village.

Sokhem has been a member of VisionFund for two loan cycles already and she completely repaid her previous loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burdens and support her business. To better support her business and respond to customers’ needs, Sokem is requesting another loan of US $1,100 to buy an embroidering machine and a laundering machine for her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business by responding to her customers’ needs on time and she also hopes to earn a larger income to make her living situation better.

loans.use: To buy an embroidering machine and a laundering machine for her business

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en:
Kuch, aged 32, has been a hard-working farmer for almost 17 years in Kompong Cham province where he happily lives with his wife, a local rice farmer, and their two children who attend school. Despite hardship, he aims to improve his rice farming business and provide the basic necessities for his two children. 

Also, Kuch plans to become involved in trading firewood to earn additional income. As a result, he is asking for a loan of 800,000 KHR to purchase a stock of firewood for trading purposes. Through the help of the loan, Kuch will have sufficient funds to invest in his new business from which he hopes to receive good revenue to support their daily sustenance and for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of firewood for trading purposes.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Sophal is now 35 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are dependents, while the others work at a garment factory to earn a living. Sophal and her husband have been rice farmers for several years. They currently earn about 23,000 KHR per day to support their family’s needs and they save about 10,000 KHR each day. 

Sophal is a second-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund and she completely repaid her first loan, which she used to relieve her family’s financial burden and generate more income. With a good business, she is applying for another loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her rice paddy and she will also use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes the loan from VisionFund will enable her to grow more healthy rice to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticide for her rice paddy

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Dambae district, where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Nat, 42, is married and has four children. She and her husband grow rice and plant cassava as the main source of their family’s income. Having been in this business for several years, they can earn about 32,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day. 

Nat has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past two loans to improve her family’s livelihood. To better support her current business, she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland and she will also use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn a larger income so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for labor

loans.name: Chlougn

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Chlougn is 42 years old and married, with five children. He is a rice farmer who has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland for 10 years to make a living. His wife is a garment worker and helps to support the family. Together, they can earn about US $18 per day from their current work and they manage to save US $5 daily for their future needs. 

This is the first loan for Chlougn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He is applying for a loan of US $1,100 to buy a cow for his farming business. He hopes to increase his farming production to generate more income and improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a cow for his farming business

loans.name: Khuoch

texts.en:
Khuoch is 24 years old and a young mother of two sons who are still small. She and her husband make a living by planting cassava on 1.5 hectares of farmland, which they have been doing for five years. They currently earn about 28,000 KHR per day and they are able to save about 18,000 KHR daily for their future needs. 

This is the first loan for Khuoch with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland and she will also use a portion of the loan to pay for labor. She hopes to grow more crops and to sell them for a good price in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Chanthorn is a 31-year-old mother of two dependent children, who are still in school. She is a rice farmer in the local area and her husband is a motor taxi driver who helps support the family. Having been in the agriculture business for ten years, Chanthorn can earn a daily income of approximately US $10 and is able to save about US $7 each day for her future needs. 

This is the second loan for Chanthorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used the first loan to improve her family’s livelihood and to relieve their financial burdens. Now she is asking for another loan of US $300. She will use this loan to buy a water pump and pipe to carry water for her rice paddy. This loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully and she also hopes to earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and pipe to carry water for her rice paddy

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 59 years old and married with eight children. She and her husband have worked very hard for years to support their big family by selling grocery items in the local area and farming rice. Now her children have their own jobs and some of them work at a garment factory. Their businesses currently earn them about US$22 per day and they manage to save about US$8 each day after expenses. 

This is the first loan for Sam with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of US$700 to buy a motorbike for her children to use. She hopes this loan will enable her children to commute to work regularly and on time and also reduce their travel time so they can help to support her grocery business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children's commute

loans.name: Chhuot

texts.en:
Chhuot, aged 63, is a single mother who is responsible for five children. She is a noble worker dedicated to her rice farming business, from which she can earn a decent income for their livelihoods. Due to the high cost of commodities, Chhuout’s family sometimes experiences financial difficulties, encouraging her involvement in a direct-selling business for additional income. Chhuot makes different kinds of Khmer cakes and sells them to people in her neighborhood. To help earn income, Chhuot’s daughter retails used clothing in a market in Kompong Cham province.

Chhuot requires a loan to increase her daughter’s stock of used clothes to maintain steady sales. She hopes that her family-owned businesses will improve with the help of the loan, and thereby increase their household income. In the future, Chhuot wants to expand her daughter's business into a large store where she can sell additional clothes.

loans.use: to increase her daughter’s stock of used clothes.

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
Son 04 años que Hannivet se dedica a la venta de ropa, su familia es confeccionista y fueron ellos quienes la animaron a dedicarse a la venta de sus prendas, fue así que empezó ofreciendo ropa a sus vecinos y amigos quienes se convirtieron en sus mejores clientas, quienes le hacen pedidos de diferentes prendas tanto para niños y damas, algunas veces sale a provincias a comercializar diferentes prendas de vestir, su trabajo es de mucha ayuda para ella, debido a su separación ella sola mantiene su hogar,  sus 02 hijos aun están en edad escolar y esto requiere muchos gastos que ella trata de solventar. El sueño de es tener una tienda de ropa donde sus clientes puedan  acudir  a comprarle, así no tendría que caminar mucho para ir  en busca de  ellos, el dinero de su préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa invernal como chompas, chalinas y casacas. Por otro lado Hannivet está muy agradecida por quienes permiten la obtención de sus préstamos que la ayudan en su progreso.

* Hannivet es la Sra.que viste polo morado esta en medio del grupo.
texts.en:
Hannivet has been selling clothing for four years. Her family are manufacturers and they encouraged her to work in clothing sales, and so it was that she began offering clothing to her neighbors and friends who became her best customers, placing orders for various outfits for ladies and children. Sometimes she goes to the provinces to sell various garments. 

Her work is very helpful because she is separated and maintains the household. Her two children are still school age and this requires a lot of expenses for her to manage.

Her dream is to have a clothing store where her customers could come to shop so she would not have to go on foot in search of clients. She will use the money from the loan to buy winter clothing such as sweaters, scarves, and jackets.

Hannivet is the lady who is wearing a purple polo and is in the middle of the group.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for resale as she is separated and maintains the household which includes 2 school age children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy a stove

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Commerçante de bazins et sacs de sortie de façon ambulante, Akuvi âgée de 58ans est mère de 02 enfants. Elle a une ancienneté de 23ans dans l’activité et désire acheter plus de marchandises, c’est pour cela, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter des sacs de sortie et des bazins. Elle voudrait à l’avenir ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Akuvi is 58 years old and mother of two children. She is an itinerant vendor of damask and handbags.

She has been in the business for 23 years and wants to buy more goods. That's why she is seeking a first loan from WAGES, in order to buy handbags and damask.

In the future, she would like to open a ready-to-wear clothing shop and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy handbags and damask

loans.name: Paula Isidora

texts.es:
Paula, sigue trabajando como conserje medio tiempo,  se ayudaba con la venta de  comida para vender en el mismo trabajo, ahora ha cambiado de negocio, debido a que el pollo y la carne aumentaron de precio, y no le quedaba ganancias. Es madre soltera de tres hijos, el mayor estudia y trabaja el pequeño negocio que ha puesto ahora, y los otros dos estudian.
Con el dinero de la venta de comida, compro dos televisores y nintendo poniendo en su casa este pequeño negocio, la hora la cobra a quince córdobas, también, está comprando bicarbonato empacando para la venta ayudándose de esta manera para lograr pagar los gastos básicos, alimentación, educación, medicina, y sus compromisos de pagos. Parte de este crecimiento lo ha logrado con financiamiento en Afodenic.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: tres televisores de 20 pulgada y tres nintendo usados, teniendo un mejor costo. Esto con el objetivo de comenzar de agrandar el negocio de nintendo.
texts.en:
Paula continues working part-time as a caretaker. Previously, she was also selling food from her work. Now she has changed her business, since chicken and beef prices have increased which has mean she no longer makes a profit. She is a single mother of three children. The oldest is studying and working in her small business, and the other two are studying. 

With the money she has made from food sales she has bought two televisions and one Nintendo console, setting up this small business in her house. She charges fifteen córdobas and hour. She is also buying bicarbonate for resale to help to meet her basic expenses: food, education, medicine and loan repayments. She has achieved part of this growth thanks to the financing of Afodenic. 

With this new loan she will buy three 20-inch televisions and three used nintendos, which have a better price. Her goal is to start to expand her Nintendo business.

loans.use: to buy three televisions and three Nintendo consoles to expand her business.

loans.name: Marhabojon

texts.ru: Мархабоджону 44 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей, четверо девочки и одного сына. Она очень добрая и честная женщина, которую уважают и любят. Более 8 лет она работает в гардеробной и получает маленькую зарплату. Ее муж мастер по деревянных изделий тоже не в состоянии обеспечить детей с хорошим образованием. Трое младших детей учатся в школе и университете. Ее третья дочь поступила в университет в этом году и поэтому Мархабоджон запрашивает кредит для оплаты учебы дочери в университете. Она ждет и надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
