Marhabojon is 44 years old. She is married and raising 5 children, four girls and a boy. Marhabojon is a very kind and honest woman who is respected and loved. For over 8 years, she has been working as a coat checker and receiving a small salary. Her husband is a master woodworker, who is also unable to fund their children's education. Their three youngest children are students in school or university.

Marhabojon's third daughter has just entered university this year and so Marhabojon is requesting this loan to pay for her education. She is hoping for and counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university education

loans.name: Wali Suma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WALISUMA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamata, está compuesta por trece integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eliza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesana en piedra caliza, venta de chuño y papa, compra y venta de ganado vacuno y ovino, tienda de barrio, venta de refrescos y cerveza, venta de fruta

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eliza es una integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y chuño mismo que ella es productora desde hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital para la próxima siembra (compra de semilla) mismo que comprará de la ciudad de La Paz, posteriormente a la cosecha los comercializará en la feria de su comunidad y las ferias aledañas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Walisuma Community Bank will soon begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamata group of businesses. There are thirteen members in Walisuma which has a board of directors headed by the President, Sra. Eliza. The members have a variety of businesses such as crafts made from limestone, selling potato flour and potatoes, buying and selling cattle and sheep, shopkeeper, soft drinks and beer selling, and fruit selling.

The loan they are seeking will benefit these small business people such as Eliza. She has been with Pro Mujer for two loan cycles, joining originally at the invitation of a facilitator from the institution who came to her house. Now she has run a business producing and selling potatoes and potato flour for many years. 

Eliza plans to use her share of the loan to buy seeds for the next crop. She will buy them in the town of La Paz. After the harvest she will sell the produce locally and also at more distant markets. The income from this work allows her to support as best she can her family as she is married.

Eliza very much likes the information about health that Pro Mujer provides.

loans.use: buy seeds

loans.name: Pann

texts.en:
Pann is a resident of Kampot province. She is 55 years old, widowed, and has six children– one married child and five single children. Pann is an industrious farmer who grows rice on her existing farmland. She has been doing this for over 30 years, earning approximately 20,000 KHR per day. 

Through her determination and hard work, Pann aims to improve her living standard and wants to open a café from her house for additional income. Because of insufficient capital for this investment, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase chairs, tables, coffees and things needed for her café shop. She hopes that lenders will support her basic finance to start up a new business.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, coffees and things needed for her café shop.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 58 years old. She manages a hog-raising business to generate income, while her husband manages a rice farming business. She has operated this business for 4 years and usually earns a profit of 8,000 PHP a month, which she usually spends for their basic necessities.

Erlinda wants to buy 2 more hogs to care for, but due financial difficulty, she is asking for additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy hogs, vitamins and feed. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the business and elevate their living condition.

loans.use: to buy hogs, vitamins and feed

loans.name: Nueva Asunción Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ASUNCIÓN” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamata, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de oveja, compra y venta de chuño, venta de verduras, tejido a mano, tienda de barrio, venta de papa

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es una integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ovejas; que inicio conjuntamente con su esposo quien le enseño esta actividad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ovejas) mismo que comprará de su misma comunidad, posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias aledañas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud
texts.en:
The Nueva Asunción communal bank will start its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamata regional office.  It is comprised of ten members, and it is run by a board of directors. Juana is the president.  The businesses that the group members are involved with are diverse, and they include selling sheep, buying and selling “chuño” [a freeze-dried potato product], selling vegetables, knitting by hand, a neighborhood store, and selling potatoes.

The loan they will take will benefit the micro entrepreneurs in Juana's group.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two cycles, and she joined by invitation from one of the Institution’s promoters who visited her at home.  She now has a business selling sheep, which she started with her husband, who taught her this business activity.

The loan that she will now take is to increase capital in order to buy sheep, which she will buy in her own community.  She will later sell them at nearby fairs.  This type of work allows her to generate resources, as much as possible, to support her family.  She is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Koim

texts.en:
Koim is 57 years old and a single mother of eight children, six of whom are already settled for marriage while the remaining three are single. She is raising her family in a small village, Kampot province. Koim engages herself in a rice farming business on a few pieces of rice field. She has been in this occupation for over 30 years. She uses the profit she generates from the business for her daily sustenance and part of it will be saved for renovation of her house.

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an addition of 1,000,000 KHR to purchase construction supplies used for housing construction. She mentioned that the loan will help her improve her living conditions so she will have a suitable house for living.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies used for housing construction.

loans.name: Peruanos A Trabajar Group

texts.es: Hola a todos desde Perú, les presento al grupo peruanos a trabaja, constituido por cinco integrantes las cuales se identifican con la lucha constante por el progreso, el desarrollo y el deseo de surgir en sus negocios. Muestra de ello es la Sra. Smith de 53 años de edad casada y madre de tres hijos, se dedica diariamente a la venta de productos de belleza en distintas partes de la capital limeña haciendo su día laboral un poco estresante. Su sueño en el futuro es poder ampliar su casa y costear los gastos de la universidad de sus hijos. Con el resiente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza como son perfumes y cremas para mano. La Sra. Smith es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora  con el objetivo de progresar en la vida. Los integrantes del grupo peruanos a trabajar al igual que la Sra. Smith se encuentran muy  agradecidas por el apoyo brindado al otorgarles este préstamo que lo invertirán en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Greetings to all of you from Peru. This 5-member group is called Peruanos a Trabajar. They are part of the daily struggle to improve, to make progress, and to develop their businesses. 

In charge of the group is 53-year old Sra. Smith who is married and has three children. She sells beauty products in various parts of the capital city, Lima, so her working day can be a little stressful. Her greatest wish is to expand her house and to pay the university expenses of her children. 

With the loan she will buy beauty products such as perfume and hand lotion. Sra. Smith is a hardworking and enterprising woman whose goal is to make progress in life. All the members of the group Peruanos a Trabajar, like Sra. Smith, are grateful for the support they receive through this loan to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: buy beauty products

loans.name: La Cantuta Group

texts.es:
Hola!!,  les escribo hoy, sin antes renovándoles las muestras de cariño y especial consideración de todos los peruanos.
Hoy les contaré sobre el grupo “La cantuta”, un grupo que está iniciando su 2º ciclo. Es un grupo numeroso porque está formado por 11 socios.
Una de las socias es Patricia, una de las más jóvenes, tiene 20 años de edad, soltera vive con su madre  y hermanos menores, además   está siguiendo estudios universitarios en  Administración.
Ella se decidió abrir una tienda de abarrotes gracias a los consejos de su madre hace aproximadamente 2 años, ya que anteriormente se dedicaban a la preparación de comidas (restaurante) y como son varios hermanos, los ingresos no eran suficientes para mantenerlos a todos.
Es así como Patricia se independizó y paga sus estudios con los ingresos que genera su tienda de abarrotes. A ella le encanta este negocio por que interactúa con sus clientes y se hace de muchos amigos. El sueño que ella tiene es poder terminar su profesión, y abrir otra tienda para poder ayudar a sus hermanos. Ella utilizará el préstamo en la compra de su mercadería como arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, menestras, cereales, etc.
Mil gracias!, es lo que nos dice, Patricia por el apoyo que se le ofrece. La fotografía de Patricia está ubicada en la parte inferior, es la primera de la izquierda viste con una casaca ploma a cuadros.
texts.en:
Hello! I am writing today but first I want to renew an indication of the display of affection and special consideration of all Peruvians.

Today we speak of the group “La Cantuta,” a group that is beginning its second cycle. It is a large group that consists of eleven members.

One of the members is Patricia, one of the youngest. She is 20 years old, single, and lives with her mother and younger siblings and is pursuing university studies in management.

She decided to open a grocery store thanks to the advice of her mother about two years ago. Previously she worked preparing food (restaurant) as were some of her siblings, but the income was not sufficient to maintain all of them. So Patricia became independent and she pays for her studies with  the money she earns from her grocery store. She likes the business because she interacts with customers and has made many friends. Her dream is to be able to complete her studies, and to open another store so she can help her siblings. She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, soft drinks, beans, cereals, and more.

A big thank you, is what Patricia says for the help that is offered. The photograph of Patricia is located at the bottom, the first from the left, and she is wearing a plaid jacket.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cereal, beans, rice, sugar, and other supplies for her grocery store to earn money which pays for her university studies

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen is a 69-year-old woman who has been residing in Kampong Chhnang with some of her children. She has four children who are married and have independent lives. Pen is involved in a retail business from her village to generate a livelihood. From her store, she sells Khmer natural medicines, false jewelry, personal care products, and other miscellaneous things to local people in her neighborhood. Pen wants to experience progress in financial matters and upgrade her living status someday.
 
As of now, Pen would like to increase her stock of merchandise for a constant sale. In connection with this, she is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy Khmer natural medicines and false jewelry from her frequent suppliers for her retail business. She hopes that through her loan, she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy Khmer natural medicines and false jewelry

loans.name: Sol De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú, les presento a un grupo entusiasta y con muchos deseos de surgir en sus negocios, así se caracteriza la alcancía sol de Vitarte conformado por 7 integrantes que luchan día a día para  cumplir sus metas. Un ejemplo de ello es la Sra. Blanca  de 44 años de edad casada y madre de 6 hijos que son su motor de vida  todos los días. La Sra. Blanca se dedica diariamente a la atención en su ferretería el cual lleva saliendo adelante por más de un año y medio. En el futuro le gustaría poder ampliar su ferretería para poder generar mayores ingresos económicos para su familia y así poder solventar los gastos de estudio de sus hijos y poder mejorar su casa. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compras de fierros y cemento para su posterior venta. La Sra. blanca se encuentra muy agradecida por la confianza  brindada al igual que la alcancía sol de vitarte quienes expresan su agradecimiento por el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru. Let me introduce you to an enthusiastic group with great desires to get ahead with their businesses. This is how the "Sol de Vitarte" group could be characterised. This group is made up of 7 members who fight daily to reach their goals. 

One example is Blanca, who is 44 years old, married and a mother of six children who are her driving force every day. Blanca earns her living from her hardware store which she has been progressing for over a year and half. In the future she would like to be able to expand her business to generate more income for her family and in this way meet the expenses of her son's education and improve her house. She will use the loan to buy iron and cement for resale.

Blanca and the "Sol de Vitarte" group are very grateful for the trust which has been afforded to them for which they express their gratitude.

loans.use: to buy iron and cement.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Chhon is 41 years of age and she continuously operates a rice-farming business as well as a direct-selling business from her house, located in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. These two businesses are great help in supporting their daily living needs and the education of her children. She has five single children, one of whom helps the family financially by working on a local rubber tree plantation.

Chhon wants to secure healthy living conditions for her children, so she is borrowing a loan as additional capital to build a bathroom accompanied with a toilet. This will be a precious loan to develop her living situation.

loans.use: to build a bathroom accompanied with a toilet.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Mr. Gantumur is 35-years-old and a driver. Since last spring he has been running passenger transportation by his minivan around Ulaanbaatar, which is the capital city of Mongolia. His wife Yanjmaa runs a second-hand clothes store in a rented shop. 

Gantumur lives with his family in the recently  built house in the ger district, an area of city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. His children always get sick in winter because of the cold at home. His house was built without wall insulation and house inside becomes the cold due to the heat loss.  

Gantumur uses a coal-fired stove to warm his house in winter. It smokes too much and damages the health of his family members as well as the environment.  So he decided to make repairs to his house including the wall insulation. He hopes it will be economic and healthy for environment. The loan he is taking will be used to pay for the building materials for his house repairs.

loans.use: To pay for building materials for his house repairs.

loans.name: Kry

texts.en:
Kry is married and has a young kid who attends primary school. He operates a transportation business in his village in Kampong Chhnang province. He typically generates approximately 10,000 KHR of revenue per day, which goes toward the family's daily sustenance and allowances for his child.

Kry would like to expand his business in order to obtain a good income. He wants to have a trailer attached to the back of his motorcycle, so he can offer his customers better tuk-tuk services and thus yield a satisfactory profit.

Due to inadequate funds, Kry is requesting a loan for the purchase of a trailer for his transportation business. He hopes to get this loan to improve his current business and he thanks all of you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer for his transportation business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a knitting machine for her business.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha was born in 1982. She has two children. The younger one is in 2nd grade. The older one is in 3rd grade. Her husband is a carpenter. She sells fruit for a living and earns 3,600,000 VND per month. The total earnings of her family are about 7,600,000 VND per month. She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2010. Last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to invest in her fruit stall. She hopes her husband’s carpentry studio could be enlarged, and she could get enough money to pay for her children’ education fees.

loans.use: to invest in her fruit stall.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана с семьей живет и работает в курортном городе Бердянске. Она реализует недорогую детскую обувь и одежду на одном из местных рынков своего родного города. Светлана работает в этой сфере уже около 10 лет, большой опыт помогает ей хорошо ориентироваться в широком разнобое оптовых цен и качестве предлагаемого закупочного товара. У Светланы пока нет своего торгового контейнера, поэтому Светлане приходится оплачивать аренду торгового места на рынке, на что уходит львиная часть ее дохода. 

Светлане необходим кредит в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию детских товаров, а именно осенне-зимнюю обувь и одежду для последующей реализации со своей торговой точки. Со временем, продолжая вкладывать в свое дело, Светлана надеется расширить свою точку и приобрести холодильник для семьи. 
Примечание: на фотографии Светлана находится в офисе, где она должна будет получить средства от КИВА.
texts.en:
Svetlana lives with her family in the resort town of Berdyansk. She's sold affordable children's shoes and clothes on one of the local markets for the last ten years, extensive experience helps her navigate through assortment, prices and demand for clothes inventory. Currently, Svetlana doesn't own her sales point and is forced to rent one, on which she has to spend most of her income. 

Svetlana is asking for a loan of 10,000 grivnas in order to to purchase a variety of children's goods, such as shoes and clothes for the fall/winter season. 
With time and investments, Svetlana hopes to purchase her own sales point and buy a refrigerator for her family. 
NOTE: Svetlana is photographed at the local branch office.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of children's goods, such as shoes and clothes for the fall/winter season.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon is a hard-working mother who is involved in rice farming as her primary source of income. During the rainy season, Lon usually works at the rice field with a few laborers in order to maintain a healthy rice crop. As a result, she has a fruitful harvest each season. She has been farming rice for 27 years. She earns in the vicinity of US$3 each day.

To satisfy their living costs and reduce some transportation costs, Lon would like to obtain a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a motorcycle for commuting. This loan will help to improve her living conditions. Lon is now 43 years old and has three children, two of whom are still dependent and attending school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy raw materials for making and selling paper and paper envelopes

loans.name: Khatia

texts.en:
Khatia is 22 years old. She lives in the village of Idleti, Kaspi district. She has a husband and a 4 year-old son. Her husband works as a stone quarry worker and gets a monthly salary. The family runs an animal husbandry business. They own 2 milk cows, a calf, a pig and a horse. Khatia produces dairy products and sells in the nearby villages. Besides her dairy business, Khatia works as a nurse to get additional income. She is a very hard-working person, with a great desire to get ahead.
Khatia requested a loan for purchasing food for cattle.  She will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the cows during the fall and winter seasons. Hay is cheap now and the price increases by 30-40% in the fall months. Khatia significantly saves on the costs of feeding the cows. Since the cows will be fed properly in winter, they will give a planned amount of milk to the family.  This will increase the family income and Khatia will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food for cattle

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
Rath is 49 years of age and a single father who lives with his only son in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. As he was born on the family farm, Rath has been farming rice as his major source of income for his whole life. He typically earns 8,000 KHR per day.

He wants to improve his farming business, which is why he is asking for a loan of 700,000 KHR to purchase fertilizers for his crop care. This will help Rath maintain a healthier rice crop, thus increasing his crop yields in harvest season. Rath will gradually grow his business towards the attainment of his goals, as he hopes to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his crop care.

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio is 27 years old. She lives in village Ude, South Georgia with her husband George and her 5-year-old son. Sopio requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for trade business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of insufficient current income of the family.  

The only source of income for the family is small scale agricultural activities. They have a plot of land, where they grow vegetables. Sopio sells harvested products on the local open market. Their average monthly income totals 500 Laris. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Sopio requested a loan from Credo to start-up a trade business. She will purchase a car, take clothing and family goods from Tbilisi (capital city of the country) wholesale markets and sell them in her and nearby villages with a price mark-up. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. The new business initiative will increase the monthly income of the family by 200 laris and the business won’t have a seasonal character. The family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car for trade business start-up

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy paper for her envelop-making business.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
Savorn lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is 56 years old and widowed with four children. 

Savorn has struggled to feed her children through working as a tailor in the local area for 36 years. The current business earns her about KHR 50,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Savorn has been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other group member is in her first cycle with VisionFund. The past loans have helped Savorn to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. 

Now she and her group member are asking for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, Savorn will use her portion to buy more fabric for sewing. She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Hayrapet

texts.en: Hayrapet is involved in agriculture. He raises cows, pigs and hens and grows fruit trees. Hayrapet would like to increase the number of cows on his farm in order to have more milk to sell. With the requested loan he plans to purchase two calves as well as forage to feed them. Hayrapet lives with his wife, Armine, and one-year-old daughter, Arpine. Development of his business is important for this young family to have a stable income to meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy two calves as well as forage to feed them.

loans.name: Sokmey

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia, Sokmey is age 28 and married with three children, two daughters and one son, all of whom are dependent on him. 

To support the family, he and his wife have been in rice farming and cassava growing for several years. They also supplement their income via selling grocery items. The current business earns them about KHR 40,000 per day and saves him about KHR 20,000 each day after daily expenses. 

Sokmey is in his third loan with VisionFund. The past two loans have helped his family with sufficient food. Now he is applying for a loan with VisionFund of KHR 3,000,000. Sokmey will use the loan to buy fertilizers for his farmland and use a portion of it to buy more grocery items for resale. He hopes to increase his income from the current business and sell the crop yields for a good price so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland and more grocery items for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy leather and shoe laces for her shoe making business

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
This is Lailani, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Nelson and is a mother. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lailani operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers sportswear, shirts and jogging pants used in physical activities in school. Seasonal demands for clothing, like uniforms, occur year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Lailani hopes her business grows and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more raw materials, like fabric, thread and other items needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Eleanora

texts.en:
This is Eleanora, 36, who lives in Manila, Philippines. She is married to Samuel and is a mother. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Eleanora operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home goods. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Eleanora hopes her business grows and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business . She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
This is Mercedez, 46, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Neptalie and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Mercedez oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Mercedez is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also for the maintenance of the motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mercedez dreams of giving her children a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru:
Шерали житель города Куляб. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Шерали один зарабатывает в семье. Он работает на рынке, где арендует торговую точку. Шерали в основном занимается торговлей мужской одежды и обуви. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. 
Шерали просит кредит для приобретения новых моделей троек, костюмов и брюк.
texts.en: Sherali lives in the city of Kulob. He is 40 years old, married, and has seven children. His wife takes care of the household, while Sherali is the sole breadwinner in the family. He rents a retail outlet at the market, where he sells mainly men's clothing and footwear. This has been Sherali's occupation for the past five years. He is requesting a loan to purchase new models of trousers and two- and three-piece suits.

loans.use: to purchase new models of trousers and two- and three-piece suits.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Jauja Group

texts.es:
Buenos Días,  reciban el saludo de todos los peruanos. Hoy les contaré,sobre Carmen Rosa, una de las socias del Grupo Corazón de Jesús – Jauja, grupo que inicia su tercer ciclo.
Carmen es madre de 3 hijos todos en edad escolar , convive con el padre de sus hijos, quien trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada, pero este trabajo solo es eventual.
Carmen  cuenta con un taller de confecciones de prenda de vestir, que lo inició cuando ella esperaba a su primer hijo hace 4 años, las necesidades que pasaban con su conviviente la animó a comprarse una máquina  de coser y ofrecer sus servicios a sus vecinos.
Con el tiempo se hizo conocida por su localidad y empezó a hacerse de capital para comprarse más maquinas de coser y otros accesorios; ya que no se abastecía porque los pedidos iban aumentando. Ella utilizará el préstamo en la compra de una máquina especial para la confección de polos.
Carmen Rosa tiene el sueño de que sus hijos sean profesionales; además, ella en  un futuro quiere tener un taller de costura más grande y con una mayor variedad de máquinas que le posibiliten confeccionar toda clase de prendas de vestir (pantalones, polos, sacos, etc.)
Carmen es la de la fotografía ubicada en la parte superior, la primera de la izquierda viste con una blusa blanca y usa gafas* También en la parte superior se la puede observar a Alcides y a Sayuri .
texts.en:
Good morning from Peru! 

Today I will tell you about Carmen Rosa, one of the members of the Corazón de Jesús Jauja Group, a group that is beginning its third cycle. Carmen is the mother of three children. All of them are school age. She lives with the father of her children who works as a heavy equipment operator, but his work is only temporary.

Carmen has a seamstress shop that she began when she was expecting her first child four years ago. The necessities that she shares with her partner was the encouragement for her to buy a sewing machine to offer her services to the neighbors. Over time her facility became known and she needed more capital to buy more sewing machines and other accessories as she couldn’t meet the demand of the orders which were increasing. She will use the loan to buy a special sewing machine for making polos.

Carmen Rosa has the dream of her children becoming professionals. Also, in the future she wants to have a larger workshop and a wider variety of machines which would offer her the possibility of making all kinds of clothing (pants, polos, bags, etc).

Carmen is located in the upper part of the photo, the first on the left with glasses and wearing a white blouse. Also in the upper part you can see Alcides and Sayuri.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for making polos in her seamstress shop

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy more quantities of coconut needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of coconut. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nenita dreams of growing her business in the coming years and hopes to have a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of coconuts needed in her business.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom is 53 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing lotus for more than two years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver who earns about $5 each day. Four of her children are construction workers. They earn about $12 daily. 

Sarom is requesting a loan of $300 to pay for her husband’s car repair. In the future, she would like to expand her business and fix some part of her house.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's car repair.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu was born in 1954. Her family is a simple family; her husband is a farmer. His income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her three children have got married and have their own family. Thu’s job is selling clothes in the market and she gets 4,000,000 VND every month. She has done it for 16 years. She has participated in the credit program of SEDA since 2008. Last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell. Then she would be able to buy a vehicle for transporting her goods.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chhaya

texts.en:
Chhaya is 43 years old and married with four children who are attending school. He is an independent entrepreneur in the construction industry. He has his own team for providing services whenever there are orders from his customers. He bids on the total contract for each construction project.

In order to keep developing his current business, he is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to purchase supplies and tools used in his construction projects. He hopes to make his business more profitable so he can provide his family with the basic necessities and provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and tools for his construction projects

loans.name: Bay

texts.en:
Bay was born in 1968. Her family is a simple family; her husband and she are cooks. They sell their Vietnamese traditional food in the market. Her family’s income is about 8,000,000 VND per month. Bay has three children. Her youngest child is in the 12th grade. Her oldest child has got married. And the other one is a soldier. 

Bay has participated in the credit program of SEDA since 2008. Last cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more ingredients for making food to sell. Then, she hopes her business could get enough money to pay for her child’s education fees.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making food to sell.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en: Edwina, 56, is very patient and caring woman. With love and affection, she works hard just to feed her family. She always sees to it that her sari-sari store business will earn enough funds for their daily living. Edwina is aiming to generate more income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional goods for her store such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, and soft drinks. She hopes to receive her requested loan in order to improve her sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her store such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, and soft drinks

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Scolastica, who is in her early 20s, is single, with one baby. She has run a food shop for two years now. She works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy food to sell in her shop, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to stock missing food items. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house and expand her business.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Saranga," which totals 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy items needed in her food shop.

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Yong is 43 years old and married, with two unmarried children who are studying at school. She manages a two-hectare farm, on which she and her spouse plant rice, potatoes, and beans to sell each harvest season. She has been in this business for almost 25 years, and she earns about 8,800 KHR per day.

Yong wants to receive a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR to purchase seeds and fertilizers and hire a tractor for tilling her land. This loan will allow her to maintain the good growth of her crops and ensure a high yield. She thanks everyone in advance for their support and help.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to hire a tractor for tilling her land.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is very industrious person. She lives with her four children because her husband has already died. She is engaged in buying and selling fish. She started her business ten years ago, and now she needs to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy fish and Styrofoam. This business is Wilma's only source of income to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and Styrofoam

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben is a 44-year-old married man and the father of two charming children. He has worked as a tricycle driver in his village for over ten years, long enough to realize the difficulties of life. Along with his hardships, he is responsible for his family. To develop his source of income, he is requesting PHP 12,000 to buy new tires and perform maintenance on his tricycle. Ruben hopes to further improve his business in the future in order to develop a new source of income, specifically buying and selling vegetables. Through these efforts, he could be able to raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy new tires and perform maintenance on his tricycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy sheep and goats for her animal sales business

loans.name: Ruom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Ruom is 40 years old and she is a married mother of six children, five daughters and one son, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

She and her husband have earned a living through pig-raising and rice-wine producing. They have been in these businesses for almost 20 years. Ruom has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan. The other group member is a first-cycle client of VisionFund. 

The first loan helped Ruom to better support her family and support the children’s education. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. Ruom will use her portion to buy pig feed for her pig-raising business. She hopes to raise her pigs to be healthy and fat so as to gain more income and improve her living conditions and especially to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc was born in 1964. He has three children. The younger one is in the second grade. The older one is a soldier. 

His wife sells fruits. He raises chickens for a living and gains from it 3,000,000 VND per month. The total earnings of his family is about 7,500,000 VND per month. 

He has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2009. The last cycle, he borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, he wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to raise more chickens. He hopes he can invest enough in his business to grow it into a standard farm, and he can get enough money to pay for his children’s education fee.

loans.use: to raise more chickens.

loans.name: Putheavy

texts.en:
Putheavy is 46 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $7 per day. 

Putheavy is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run grocery store at home in order to generate more income to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Chiriku Group

texts.en:
Shabani, who is in his early 30s, is married, with three children, one of which still goes to school. He has been selling bicycle spare parts for six years now. He works from 6am to 6pm daily, and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

He is requesting his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy more bicycle spare parts. His dream is to one day be a big businessman.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Chiriku," which totals 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Hermosa

texts.en:
This is Hermosa. She previously accessed a 32,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and tools for the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Hermosa hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Al-Sultan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Sultan and is made up of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Jamila is a 48-year-old livestock seller (she is the woman who is seated in the photo); she is married and has eight children. She has been selling livestock successfully for many years. 

Jamila took out a loan of 50,000 YER (her share of the group loan) to finance her business. She plans to buy more sheep to resell to her customers. She will use the proceeds to buy more livestock and will use the rest of her income to invest back into her business. She hopes to have a successful business and a financially stable life.

loans.use: to buy more sheep to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Al-Noory Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Noory and is made up of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. The representative of the group, who is named Samah, is a married woman who has two children (she is the woman who appears on the left in the photo). She is a very happy, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to get ahead. She has been operating a small beauty salon for one year.  

She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER (her share of the group loan) from Kiva's partner, AMB, to buy more cosmetic materials for her business. She works about 10 hours a day and believes her business succeeds because of her dedication and friendly customer service.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic materials for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 50, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Francisco, a farmer, and is mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a coconut stand. She buys coconuts that are native to the Philippines and which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of coconut to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Teresita dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partner /clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of coconut needed in her business.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en: Phy is a resident of Baray district, where she peacefully lives with her spouse and four unmarried children. She is 39 years old. To earn a living, Phy devotes herself to farming rice and fishing, the income from which allows her to cover her daily costs and support her children’s education. She has been in these businesses for more than 10 years with great support from her husband. Phy and her husband want to invest their earnings in an animal trading business. Due to a lack of additional capital she has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to purchase a couple of cows. She will fatten them for a short time before selling them to butcher. This loan will allow her to make her business viable and profitable in the future. She hopes to earn a better income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of cows for fattening.

loans.name: Veronica Jean

texts.en:
This is Veronica. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at her general store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Veronica hopes to be able to expand her business soon and dreams of giving her a family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Al-Sana Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Sana and it consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. Sana is 38 years old; she is a married woman who has two children (she is second from the left in the photo). She started her business on a small scale selling cloth two years ago. Over time, her income has increased and she is now able to cover the cost of her children's expenses. 

She has to expand her business activities so she requested a loan of 40,000 YER (her share of the group loan) to buy dresses, pants, blouses, etc. for resale. This would enable her to earn larger profits by catering to a large number of clients.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pants, blouses, etc. for her clothing business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 27, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rebecca operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Php worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rebecca hopes to grow her business and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for more grocery products needed in her business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, age 52, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a mother to her four children. She, together with her children, manages the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Milagros operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Milagros hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es:
Don Jimmy es comerciante de venta de pan, tiene la edad de 45 años, casado, padre de tres hijos estudiantes, hoy en día su mayor anhelo es el mejoramiento de su casa, siendo sencilla y queriendo construir de concreto. Su pequeño negocio lo comenzo trabajando  en una panadería, que luego renuncio y con su ahorro, comienza a comprar el pan y se dedica a vender en un punto fijo en un mercado, teniendo una rica variedad de pan.
Opto al financiamiento en Afodenic, con el fin de hacer las mejoras a su casa, siendo mitad de tabla, lo que construirá de concreto, haciéndosele por este medio más viable al ser a plazos accesibles. Comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, piedrín y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Jimmy sells bread. He is 45 years old, married, and the father of three children who are school age. 

These days his greatest desire is the improvement of his home, a simple home of concrete. His business began when he started working in a bakery, and later he quit and with his savings he started buying bread to sell in a stall at the market, and he has a delicious variety of bread.

He is getting financing through Afodenic in order to make improvements to his partially boarded home, which he will build with concrete, finding it more manageable to do in installments. He will buy stones, sand, cement, iron, and gravel to begin the work.

loans.use: to buy supplies to enclose his home with concrete

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair her food kiosk and buy more beef and seasoning

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: El señor Wilson tiene 44 años y tres hijos de las edades de 15, 11 y 2 años, su actividad es  el alquiler de servicio de amplificación,  esta actividad la realiza los fines de semana o cuando tiene contratos esta  actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia sus hijos se encuentran estudiando, la esposa también ayuda en los gastos del  hogar con pequeñas ventas de temporada de distintos productos, el destino del crédito es para la compra de equipos y accesorios de sonido , logrando de  esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y poder consolidarse en su actividad, ya que por estas fechas tiene mucho trabajo, el Sr. Wilson es joven y trabajador con muchos deseos de superación quiere brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor este trabajo es muy cansador ya que alquila sus servicios a distintos acontecimientos sociales, ya sean bautizos matrimonios, graduación y prestes y muchos de estos acontecimientos terminan en la madrugada, y el Sr. Wilson tiene nomas que trasnocharse en muchas ocasiones, como es su trabajo tiene que salir adelante trabajando duro, se siente agradecido por la oportunidad que le brinda la institución en mejorar cada día su actividad.
texts.en: Wilson is 44 years old and has three children, ages 15, 11, and 2.  He runs a business renting amplification services.  He works on the weekends or when he has a contract.  This is the main source of income for he and his family.  His children are still in school.  His wife also helps with the household expenses with small sales of specific seasonal products.  The loan will be used to purchase sound equipment and accessories, thus allowing him to improve his income and  consolidate his business, since he has a lot of work in these dates.  Wilson is young and hard-working with a great desire to succeed.  He wants to offer his children a better future.  This job is very tiring since he rents his services to specific social events such as baptisms, weddings, graduations, and many of these events end in the early morning.  Wilson is used to staying up very late on many occassions, since this is his job and he has to continue working hard.  He feels grateful for the opportunity that the organization is offering him to improve his business each day.

loans.use: to purchase sound equipment and accessories.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis tiene 20 años, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan de harina de arroz, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la localidad de el Torno,   este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Luis  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de harina de arroz, manteca y azúcar por cantidad ya que tiene  un horno de mayor capacidad y quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, Luis enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de una panadería que produce en mayor cantidad, con este crédito mejorara sus ganancias, Luis es una persona joven  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantenerse.
texts.en:
Luis is 20 years old. He works making bread from rice flour. His bakery is located in the town of Torno.

This loan is his second cycle with the institution. Luis is going to use the loan to buy rice flour, butter and sugar in bulk since he has a large capacity oven and wants to increase production in order to satisfy the demand of his customers.

Luis faces challenges in his business such as competition from a bakery that produces in bulk. With this loan he will improve his earnings. Luis is a young person eager to get ahead and is happy and grateful with the institution for the support given because this is his only source of income to maintain himself.

loans.use: to buy rice flour, butter, and sugar in quantity so he can make more bread to meet the demand of his customers

loans.name: Tania Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una  hija de tres años. El marido es supervisor de una camaronera.
 
Ella con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudara a su familia a salir adelante se dedica a la preparación y venta de postres y dulces, también prepara almuerzos y meriendas pero solo para entregar, además de comida para fiestas y recepciones, por lo general casi todas las semanas tiene un compromiso social y  ella se encarga de la comida y los dulces. Lleva 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que sus dulces y comida es deliciosa.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 7 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio.

Su meta es darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Artesanal" meets every 15 days in Jipijapa canton.  This canton known by the name of "the sultan of coffee,"  because of its extensive plantings of coffee, which has an incomparable flavor, as well as for its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Tania, 32, lives in this place.  She is in a common-law marriage from which she has a 3 year-old daughter.  Her husband works as a supervisor for a shrimp company.

In order to earn some money on her own, and to help her family get ahead, Tania has a business preparing and selling desserts and sweets.  She also prepares lunches and snacks that she delivers and makes food for parties and receptions.  Almost every week there is some sort of social event where she is in charge of the food and the dessert.  She has been doing this work for 7 years, and it is going very well because her desserts and meals are delicious.

With this loan, she will buy rice, meat, fish and other groceries to make the food.  She has been with this communal bank for 7 loan cycles, and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot with her business.

Her goal is to provide the best for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other groceries to make food to sell

loans.name: Gina Mariana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Gina, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  20 y 13 años  de edad, ambos estudian en Universidad y  colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja unos tres días por semana pero por horas, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 14 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado durante todo este tiempo. 

Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Artesenal meets every two weeks in the Canton Jipijapa which is known as the sultaness of coffee because of the extensive plantings of coffee there which has an incomparable flavor.  It is also known for its excellent food and for the warmth of its people.

Here lives Gina.  She is 48 years old, is married and from this marriage has two children of 20 and 13 years of age.  Both study: in the university and high school.  Her husband is a driver.

With the intention of earning something on her own and with this be able to get ahead, she works selling clothing of all types.  Her sales method is door to door and she also sells in her house where she has a small store.  She works three days a week.  She gives her clients credit and charges every two weeks.  She goes to buy her merchandise in Guayaquil each time she needs to.  She has done this work for more than 10 years and it is going well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, tee shirts and children's clothing.  She has been part of the communal bank for more than 14 years and she likes it for the help that they have given her during all of that time.

Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, tee shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Laura Victoria

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Laura, tiene 72 años de edad, es madre soltera de  un hijo el cual es mayor de edad y aunque ya está comprometido aun vive con ella.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre tuvo que luchar muy duro para sacar adelante su hijo, en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos días por las mañanas ya que es mas fresco a esa hora y siempre  encuentra a sus clientes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad, ya que antes se dedicaba a la  venta de comida.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado en todo este tiempo.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “Artesanal” communal bank meets every two weeks in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the “Sultana of Coffee” because of the vast plantations of incomparably flavored coffee there, for its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

Laura, 72, lives here.  She’s a single mother of an adult son who although he’s engaged already still lives with her.  She’s a very tenacious woman who had to struggle mightily to support her son.  She currently sells clothes via catalogue as well as Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She works every day during the morning since it’s cooler then and she can always find her customers.  She sells on credit and collects payment weekly.  She’s been in this business five years; she used to work selling food.
 
This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and all types of clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because of all the help she’s gotten throughout this time.  Her dream is to continue forward and to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Candelaria Aida

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Candelaria, tiene 48 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Ella lleva dos años y medios en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado a pesar de no contar con el respaldo de un esposo.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder salir adelante sin depender de nadie se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, bisutería, vinchas y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Cuando necesita más mercadería viaja hasta Guayaquil a proveerse de más productos.  Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
	
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, vinchas, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otros productos.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
The “Artesanal” communal bank meets every two weeks in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the “Sultana of Coffee” because of the vast plantations of incomparably flavored coffee there, for its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

Candelaria, 48, lives here.  She’s separated but has four adult children two of which still live at home wither.  She’s been in the communal bank for two-and-a-half years and likes it because of the help they’ve given her even though she does not have a husband to back her up.

She is a housewife who in order to earn income of her own to get ahead and not be dependent on anyone sells all types of clothes, costume jewelry, headbands and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week from two to three hours daily.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  When she needs more merchandise she goes all the way to Guayaquil to stock up on more products.  She’s been in this business for four years and does very well.

This loan is to buy clothes, headbands, perfume, creams and cosmetics, among other products.  Her dream is to continue increasing her sale and profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes, headbands, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Zoila Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  23, 20 y 12 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio, todos ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito tanto para ella como para su esposo ya que ambos se dedican a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatos, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta mientras ella recorre por lugares cercanos su esposo se desplaza hasta otras ciudades, trabajan cuatro días por semana aunque su esposo mas días que ella, ellos  dejan a crédito a sus clientes  y cobran cada quince días o por semana. Su mercadería  la compran en  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesiten. Tienen más de 8 años que se dedican a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo van emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y zapatos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 16 años y le gusta por la responsabilidad y seriedad tanto de sus compañeras como de la institución.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The “Artesanal” communal bank meets every two weeks in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the “Sultana of Coffee” because of the vast plantations of incomparably flavored coffee there, for its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

Zoila, 47, lives here.  She’s married and has three children who are 23, 20 and 12 years of age.  The two older ones attend university and the youngest is in secondary school.  They all still live with her and her husband is a merchant.

Aiming to earn income of her own and help her husband cover household expenses, she’s taking out the loan for herself and to help her husband since they both work selling clothes of all types and shoes.  She sells door to door in areas near her home while her husband heads out to other cities.  They work four days a week although her husband works more days than she does.  They sell on credit and collect payments every two weeks or weekly.  
They buy the merchandise in Guayaquil every two weeks or monthly according to need.  They’ve been in this business more than 8 years and do very well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and shoes.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than 16 years and likes it because of the responsibility and seriousness both of the members and of the institution.  Her dream is that her children complete their schooling and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер родился 10 марта 1990 года. В 1997 поступил в школу и в 2008 году успешно окончил. После окончания школы он поступил в Петербургский Государственный Архитектурно- строительный Университет и данное время перешел на 5 курс. Он очень способный молодой человек. Алишер увлекается спортом и в свободное время читает зарубежную литературу. Его отец работает в частной фирме на должности заместителя директора, а мать домохозяйка. Кроме Алишера в семье есть еще один сын, который работает менеджером по продаже в частной фирме. Родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу в этом году. Он запрашивает кредит для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте вместе поможем молодому специалисту окончить университет и реализовать свои знания в будущем.
texts.en:
Alisher was born on March 10, 1990. In 1997 he entered school and graduated in 2008, after which he enrolled in the St. Petersburg State University of Architecture and Construction, where he is currently a fifth-year student. Alisher is a very capable young man. He participates in sports and reads foreign literature in his spare time. His father works as a vice-president at a private company, while his mother takes care of the household. The family has one other son who works as a sales manager in a private firm. 

Alisher's parents are unable to pay for his education this year. He is requesting a loan to pay for his university studies and is counting on your kindness. Let's together help this young specialist graduate from university and use his knowledge in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his university studies

loans.name: Carolyn Johana

texts.es:
Carolyn es una joven emprendedora que debido a que en su hogar tenían grandes dificultades económicas y ella necesitaba dinero para poder estudiar, decidió montar su propio negocio de venta de ropa y así puede generar ingresos con los cuales paga sus estudios y también tiene la oportunidad de contribuir económicamente a sus padres para que estos puedan gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Cuando empezó, a pesar de que no contaba con muy buen capital, logró conseguir un proveedor de muy buena calidad que le ha permitido ofrecer a sus clientes muy buenos productos y esto le ha permitido venir creciendo cada vez más, y gracias a esto tanto sus estudios han ido siendo pagados, como sus padres han podido tener mejores oportunidades económicas en su hogar. Debido a que actualmente tiene unos pedidos por parte de sus clientes que por falta de capital no logra satisfacer, Carolyn busca un préstamo para comprar ropa y satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes y así superar su dificultad de capital.

Su mayor sueño es que este negocio siga saliendo adelante y le permita terminar de pagar sus estudios y lograr el anhelo de graduarse de profesional. Además aspira a que su familia pueda disponer de una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas gracias al negocio.
texts.en:
Carolyn is an enterprising young woman who, because of economic difficulties at home and needing money to study, decided to start her own business selling clothes. That way she can generate income with which to pay for her studies and also contribute economically to her parents so that they can enjoy a better quality of life. When she began, despite not having much capital, she was able to get a good quality supplier which allowed her to offer her clients very good products that allowed her to grow once more. Thanks to that all of her studies have been paid for as her parents have been able to have better economic opportunities in their home. Now she has some orders from some of her customers that, due to lack of money, she can’t fill. Carolyn is seeking a loan to buy clothes and fill her clients’ orders and, in that way, overcome her money problems. 

Her dream is that this business continues moving forward and allows her to finish her studies and achieve her goal of graduating as a professional. Furthermore she wants her family to be able to have a better quality of life and better economic opportunities thanks to the business.

loans.use: to  buy clothes and fill her client orders.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
This is Anabelle, 49, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, a vendor, and mother to her six children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Anabelle operates a coconut and banana stand. She buys coconut fruit that are native to the Philippines, which are grown mostly in the southern region of Luzon. She also sells bananas. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day. To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan.
