She will utilize the loan to buy more coconuts to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Anabelle dreams to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy coconuts

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбару 50 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж Олим работает начальником технического отдела телерадиокомпании «Диер». Санавбар окончила медицинский колледж и является по специальности медсестрой, но данное время она занимается оформлением бровей. Ее дочь Шахерезада поступила в Политехнический Университет Таджикистана по специальности Программист-экономист. Шахерезада увлекается кулинарией и музыкой. У нее превосходный талант. В будущим она хочет быть успешной и богатой. Санавбар и Шахерезада ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sanavbar is 50 years old. She is married and raising 4 children. Her husband Olim works as the head of the technical department at the TV and radio company Dier. Sanavbar graduated from medical college and is a nurse by profession, but presently she works as a cosmetician.

Sanavbar's daughter Shaherizada has entered the Tajikistan Polytechnic University to study towards a degree in Programming and Economics. Shaherizada enjoys cooking and music, and has a wonderful talent. In the future, she would like to be successful and rich. Sanavbar and Shaherizada are looking forward to your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education at the university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and to be able to fulfill clients' orders.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa, 39, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, a salesman, and is the mother of one child. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elsa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elsa hopes to grow her business and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna.  She previously received a PHP 30,000 that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lorna hopes her business grows more in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nancy Azucena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Artesanal  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo el cual es mayor de edad pero aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio del cantón.

Ella para salir adelante junto a su familia y para poder aportar con los gastos del hogar hace mas de 13 años con los ahorros que tenia y con ayuda de su esposo puso en su casa una pequeña tienda, la misma que con el paso del tiempo y con ayuda de los créditos que ha recibido de parte de la fundación Espoir la ha ido mejorando y surtiendo cada dia mas,  allí vende todo tipo de productos y también en su local realiza recargas telefónicas de varias operadoras,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayuda cuando está desocupado, aunque siempre es ella que está en su local  ya que allí además de ganar algo se entretiene.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres  para surtir más su tienda.  Está en el Banco Comunal hace 10 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha mejorado mucho su local. 

Su meta es seguir adelante y mejorando aun más su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Artesanal” communal bank meets every two weeks in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the “Sultana of Coffee” because of the vast plantations of incomparably flavored coffee there, for its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

Nancy, 48, lives here and has an adult son who still lives with her.  Her husband works for the canton’s municipality.  In order to get ahead with her family and to contribute to household expenses she opened a small store at home more than 13 years ago with some savings of hers and some help she got from her husband.  With the passage of time and with help from the loans she’s gotten from Fundación Espoir the store has been improving and she’s been stocking it more all the time.   She sells all types of products there and she also provides mobile phone recharges for several providers.  
She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Her son helps her when he’s not busy although it’s usually she who is at the store because in addition to earning some money she also keeps herself entertained.

She will use the loan to buy groceries to stock her store.  She’s been in the communal bank for 10 years and likes it because all the loans have improved her store very much.  Her goal is to continue forward and improving her business still more.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
This is Gliceria, who is 61 years old and a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Policarpio, a businessman, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gliceria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gliceria hopes to grow her business and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita.  She previously received a PHP 14,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nenita dreams that her business will become bigger and she will be able to enjoy life with good health and abundance. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as she studies. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Gulsora

texts.ru: Гулсора успешная,трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина.    Она замужем, имеет троих детей. В поисках источника дохода в 2000 году она начала свой бизнес в месте со свекровью.    Они занимаются продажей свадебных платьев. У них имеется свой свадебный салон и там они продают свадебные платья.   А муж ее предприниматель а также помогает Гулсоре по бизнесу.   Так как у нас осенью начинается сезон свадеб Гулсора хочет расширить свой товарооборот и закупить несколько свадебных платьев.    Поэтому она обратилась в нашу организацию и надеется на нашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulsora is a successful, hard-working and conscientious woman. She is married and has three children. Looking for a source of income, she launched her own business in 2000 together with her mother-in-law. They sell wedding dresses at their own salon. Gulsora's husband is an entrepreneur, but also helps his wife with her business. 

As Tajikistan's wedding season begins in the fall, Gulsora would like to expand her inventory and buy several new wedding dresses. For this reason, she has turned to MDO Arvand, LLC and hopes for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses for her shop

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis Eduardo se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la venta de pescado y con este negocio ha generado los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Debido a que sus padres se dedicaban a esta actividad, Luis Eduardo la aprendió desde muy temprana edad y esto le permitió conocer como se manejaba el negocio, y ahora gracias a la experiencia puede sobrevivir con la venta de pescado y ofrecerle a su familia una calidad de vida digna. Anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo en una caja sus pescados y gracias a que sus clientes iban aumentando tuvo la necesidad de obtener un transporte, y así compró el vehículo donde ahora transporta los pescados y los vende a sus clientes. Buscando superar la dificultad de capital que tiene, Luis Eduardo busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de pescados y responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que gracias a el sus hijos puedan tener una educación de buena calidad. Además, lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y ofrecerles mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Luis Eduardo has dedicated much of his life to selling fish and has generated income from this business. He needs this income to manage household costs of his home, in which he lives with his wife and four children. Since his parents worked in this business, Luis Eduardo learned the work from a vary early age and this has allowed him to know how to manage the business. Now, thanks to this experience, he can make a living by selling fish and provide his family with a decent quality of life. Previously, he had worked by selling his fish in a box. Since his customers were increasing, he had to find transportation, so he bought a vehicle that he now uses to transport the fish and sell them to customers. Looking to increase the capital he has, Luis Eduardo is requesting a loan to buy assorted fish and respond to customer requests.

His dream is to improve and move forward with his business. Thanks to this, his children can have a quality education. Also, he wants to provide a better quality of life for his family and offer them better economic opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish and respond to customer requests

loans.name: Gullapungro  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
Este es el primer crédito que realizan todas las integrantes del banco comuna Gullanpugro, se enteraron de este crédito por otras amigas de la comunidad que ya forman parte de otros bancos comunales, son 8 mujeres humildes y trabajadoras, se dedican en su mayor parte a la cría de animales y a la agricultura ya que les gusta el trabajo del campo, algunos salen a laborar en la ciudad en especial los jóvenes. Viven por el cantón Nabón lugar que tiene un clima muy frió, cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gastronomía es típica al igual que la vestimenta de su gente las mismas que la lucen muy orgullosas de aun mantener viva su cultura. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Elvira, tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, tres de sus hijos trabajan y viven independientes, sus otros tres hijos estudian a distancia, también trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, solo una de sus hijas trabaja para sus gastos personales. Su esposo labora como agricultor, la casa en la que vive es el fruto del arduo trabajo conyugal.

Doña María Elvira forma parte de una organización en la cual se dedican a la siembra en viveros de diferentes flores y otras plantas, las mismas que venden en la ciudad en masetas, esta actividad la desempeña hace 10 años, también se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas  y sus cosechas las vende, tiene varios animales como son: cerdos, borregos, cuyes y ganado del cual obtiene la leche que la vende en su comunidad.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para continuar con los viveros.
 
Su meta es  creer en la crianza de ganado.
texts.en:
This is the first loan the members of the “Gullanpugro” communal bank have taken out.  They found out about the loan through other girlfriends in the community who are already members of other communal banks.  They are 8 humble, hardworking women who for the most part work raising animals and in agriculture because they like working in the fields.  Some of them, especially the young ones, go to work in the city.  They live in Nabón Canton, a place with a very cold climate that has many places were nature can be enjoyed.  Its cuisine and the clothing the people wear are traditional and people wear them proud to be able to still maintain their culture alive.

One of the group members is María Elvira, 46.  She’s married and has 7 children.  Three of her children work and live on their own and her other three are in distance education programs and also work and help her out economically.  Only one of her daughters works for to cover her own personal expenses.  Her husband works as a farmer and the house they live in is the fruit of their hard labor as a couple.

María Elvira forms part of an organization that plants various flowers and other plants in nurseries that are then potted and sold in the city.  She’s been in this activity for 10 years.  She also grows vegetables that she sells and has various animals like pigs, sheep, guinea pigs and dairy cattle that produce milk she sells in her community.

She will use the loan to buy manure to continue with the nurseries.  Her goal is to expand the cattle raising.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn.  She previously received a PHP 15,000 loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products for her new business, which is a variety store. (In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg.) The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn hopes to grow her business and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru: Хамида родилась 1994 года в городе Душанбе. Она очень способная девушка, окончила школу с отличием и поступила в Технологический Университет Таджикистана в факультет Управление внешнеэкономической деятельности. Хамида хочет стать хорошим экономистом. Ее мать работает бухгалтером в телекомпании и получает маленькую зарплату, которая не хватает для оплаты учебы. Хамида запрашивает кредит на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hamida was born in Dushanbe in 1994. She is a very bright young woman. Hamida graduated from high school with honors and has been accepted to the Technological University of Tajikistan to study at the Department of International Business Management.
Hamida wants to become a good economist. Her mother works as an accountant in a television company and earns a low salary that is not enough to pay for Hamida's education. Hamida has requested a loan of 1,000 USD to pay her tuition. She appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more fabric and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Naudel Antonio

texts.es:
Naudel es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y esto le ha permitido obtener los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para poder brindar el sustento necesario. Durante gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a la actividad de la agricultura y el campo, y gracias a esta experiencia tiene la oportunidad de ser reconocido por tener productos de muy buena calidad. Actualmente tiene una cerda y esta está en etapa de gestación, por lo que las crías ya pronto le generarán unos ingresos que requiere. Pero debido a que los pedidos de sus clientes no los puede abastecer completamente, Naudel busca un préstamo para comprar un cerdo y aumentar su capacidad de producción para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida y ofrecerles un buen crecimiento a su hijo recién nacido y su hijo de 8 años.
texts.en: Naudel’s a person who has always been noted for being very hardworking and this has made it possible for him to earn income to provide his home with the necessary support.  For a great part of his life he’s worked in agriculture and in the fields and thanks to this experience he’s well-known for producing very good quality products.  He currently has a pregnant sow so piglets will soon produce income he needs.  But because he can’t completely fill customer orders, Naudel needs a loan to buy a pig to increase production capacity and respond to customer orders.  His greatest dream is to be able to provide his family with a good quality of life and offer good growth to his newborn son and to his 8-year-old son.

loans.use: to buy a pig.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pig and pay for its care, and to be able to fulfill her clients' requests.

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.es:
Margarita ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido una gran fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando junto a sus hijos. Desde muy joven aprendió la actividad de vender productos gracias a que su padre se la enseñó desde muy pequeña, y ahora que tiene las obligaciones de su hogar, hace de esta actividad su fuente de ingresos. Margarita es madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 3 hijos debido a que el padre de sus hijos los abandonó desde hace un tiempo y sin hacer alguna contribución económica para su sostenimiento, lo que ha hecho que las dificultades económicas en su hogar aparezcan constantemente y tenga que esforzarse todos los días en su trabajo para poder superarlas poco a poco. Gracias a que ha tenido muy buenas ventas en los últimos meses, Margarita busca un préstamo que le permita comprar ropa para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que le permita brindarles a sus 3 hijos una buena educación y una calidad de vida digna. Además, tiene el anhelo de que su negocio le permita terminar de construir su casa y tener una vivienda en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Margarita has had to go through many adversities in her life.  Notwithstanding, she’s always had great strength to continue forward with her children making progress.  She learned how to sell products while still very young because he father taught her how when she was still little and now that she has household obligations this activity is her source of income.  

Margarita is a single mother head of household with three children because the father of her children abandoned them some time ago making no economic contribution towards their support which has caused her home to constantly face economic difficulties which force her to have to strive mightily every day in her work to overcome them little by little.  Thanks to the good sales she’s had these last few months, Margarita is looking for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy more clothes to meet customer demand.

Her greatest dream is to move the business forward so that she can provide her three children with a good education and more dignified life.  She also hopes that her business will make it possible for her to finish building her house and have a home in better condition.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa Emilia es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por grandes adversidades en la vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar brindándoles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. Madre soltera cabeza de hogar de sus 10 hijos, pues su esposo murió hace un tiempo, Rosa Emilia aún debe garantizar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, pues a pesar de que algunos ya se encuentran grandes y tienen sus propios trabajos, todavía tiene 3 hijos que les debe garantizar el acceso a una educación de buena calidad y el sustento diario. Para poder generar sus ingresos Rosa Emilia tiene una venta de comidas, y debido a que sus clientes se lo han venido solicitando, espera comenzar con una fábrica de arepas para venderlas en su municipio. Ya que no cuenta con un gran capital para esto, Rosa Emilia busca un préstamo para comprar un molino eléctrico, los utensilios necesarios y los insumos para comenzar a fabricar arepas.

Su sueño es que sus hijos salgan adelante y con su apoyo puedan tener acceso a una educación de buena calidad. Además, aspira a tener un buen negocio que sea bien organizado y les permita prosperar.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia is a person who has had to pass through great adversities in her life; however, she has always had the strength to move forward and continue providing a good quality of life for her children.  She is a single mother and the head of her home with 10 children.  Her husband died awhile ago, and Rosa Emilia still wants to guarentee a good quality of life for her children, even though some are already grown and have their own jobs.  She still has 3 children that she wants to grant access to a good quality education and provide for their daily needs.  In order to generate income, Rosa Emilia has a business preparing and selling meals and since her customers have come to her with requests, she hopes to start making arepas to sell in her municipality.  Since she doesn't have much capital for this, Rosa Emilia requests a loan to purchase an electric mill, necessary utensils, and supplies to begin making arepas.

Her dream is that her children succeed and with her support can have access to a good quality education.  Moreover, she aspires to have a good business that is well-organized and allows her to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase an electric mill, necessary utensils, and the supplies to begin to make arepas.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
This is Analiza.  She previously received a PHP 10,000 loan that she used in buying raw materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy raw materials needed in her bakery. 

Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Analiza hopes her business would grow and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 57, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Felix who works abroad. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nenita operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nenita hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
This is Julie. She previously took out a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Julie hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1982. She has five children. They are learning at secondary school, primary school, and kindergarten. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Dung sells fruits and raises pigs for a living and gains from it 4,000,000 VND per month. The total earnings of her family is about 7,000,000 VND per month. 

She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to enlarge her fruit stall. Then, she hopes her business can get enough money to pay for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to enlarge her fruit stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain her two plots of dragonfruit.

loans.name: Lourdeliza

texts.en:
This is Lourdeliza, 36, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Michael, a baker's helper, and a mother to her child. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Lourdeliza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lourdeliza hopes to grow her business and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, she previously accessed a 20,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan that she used in buying raw materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 16,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy raw materials needed in printing. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Evangeline hopes to grow her business and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
Maria tiene experiencia de 10 años en la actividad de la confección y trabajó durante mucho tiempo en una empresa, pero debido a que el padre de sus hijos la abandonó hace un tiempo, Maria ha quedado a cargo de las obligaciones de su hogar donde convive con sus 2 hijos y a quienes les debe garantizar una buena calidad de vida. En busca de tener mayores ingresos, Maria se puso en la ardua tarea de montar su propio taller de confección, y ya hace un año aproximadamente que montó su taller el cual a pesar de iniciarlo con muy poco capital, ha logrado sacar adelante con el esfuerzo que hace diariamente. Buscando ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina plana con la que pueda ofrecer el servicio de confección completo. 

Su mayor sueño es que sus 2 hijos tengan acceso a una educación de buena calidad y en un futuro a una educación universitaria. Además aspira a que su taller de confección pueda salir adelante y algún día generar empleo para otras personas muy necesitadas.
texts.en:
María has ten years’ experience making clothes and worked for a firm for many years.  But because the father of her children abandoned them some time ago, María was left in charge of all household obligations.  She lives with her two children and she must insure a good quality of life for them.

Seeking to earn higher income, María set the difficult goal of setting up her own sewing workshop and about a year ago started her own workshop that although she started out with little capital,  she’s managed to move forward thanks to her constant efforts.  In order to provide better customers service, María is looking for a loan to buy a straight-stitch sewing machine to be able to offer all-inclusive sewing services.

Her greatest dream is that her two children have access to a good quality education and in future to a university education.  She also hopes her sewing workshop will move forward and one day employs other very needy people.

loans.use: to buy  sewing machine.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y esto le ha permitido superar las grandes dificultades que se le han presentado en la vida. Desde muy joven aprendió la actividad de la agricultura junto a su padre, y es en esta actividad que siempre se ha desempeñado y con la cual ha generado los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su esposa y sus 8 hijos. Gracias a la experiencia que tiene, es reconocido por sacar productos de muy buena calidad, lo que hace que sus clientes sigan creciendo y le brinden mayores oportunidades para progresar en la vida junto a su familia. A pesar de que algunos de sus hijos ya son mayores y tienen su propio empleo, Luis aún debe garantizar el acceso a una educación universitaria a sus otros hijos y por esto las condiciones económicas en su hogar se han visto fuertemente afectadas. Buscando seguir saliendo adelante con su cultivo, Luis busca un préstamo para comprar semillas, riegos y abonos para sacar adelante su cultivo.

Su mayor sueño es ver a todos sus hijos progresando y brindándoles una buena calidad de vida a sus familias, de modo que se pueda sentir a gusto con la educación y la calidad de vida que les ha brindado.
texts.en:
Luis is a person who has always been described as being very hardworking. That has allowed him to overcome the great difficulties that have occurred in his life. When he was very young he learned the agriculture business with his father. He’s always worked in this business which has generated the income necessary to support his wife and their 8 kids. Thanks to his experience, he’s known for producing high quality products. His client base has grown and has brought him better opportunities to progress in life together with his family. Despite some of his kids already being grown and having their own work, Luis still has to guarantee access to a university education to his other kids and so the economic condition of the household has been greatly affected. Aiming to continue getting ahead through his farming, Luis is looking for a loan to buy seeds, irrigation, and manure to move ahead with his crop.

His greatest dream is to see all of his kids progressing and giving their families a good quality of life, so that he can feel good about the education and quality of life he’s given them.

loans.use: to buy seeds, irrigation, and manure for farming.

loans.name: Remelita

texts.en:
This is Remelita, 34, a resident of Manila in the Philippines. She is married to Marco, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Remelita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer's prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are depending on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Remelita hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to have a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Honesto

texts.en:
This is Honesto. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities and varieties of medicines to expand his inventory. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in his personal, household, and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan so he can buy more quantities and varieties of medicines. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in his heart.

Honesto hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for medicines and products needed in his business

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu was born in 1964. She has a normal family, and her husband is an electrical repairman. His income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has two children, and they do carpentry for a living. Thu raises pigs and is a worker for a farm. She earns 2,000,000 VND every month. She has been doing this for 20 years. Her family’s total income is about 6,500,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA's credit programs since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to expand her farm and buy more electrical-repair tools for her husband's job.

loans.use: To expand her farm and buy more electrical-repair tools for her husband’s job

loans.name: Dua

texts.en:
Dua was born in 1964. She has four children. The two younger children are learning at high school and primary school. The older one has married; the oldest is a hairdresser. Dua’s husband has retired. His pension is 2,000,000 VND per month. 

Dua has a grocery store and gains from it 2,800,000 VND per month. The total earnings of her family is about 6,800,000 VND per month. 

She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2008. The last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to enlarge her grocery store. Then, she hopes her business can get enough money to pay for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to enlarge her grocery store.

loans.name: Hector Ivan

texts.es:
Hector es un joven muy luchador que ha trabajador fuertemente en la vida para salir adelante y poder ayudar a sus padres ya que proviene de una familia con muy escasos recursos económicos. Desde hace un tiempo consiguió empleo en una cafetería y trabajando fuertemente ha venido sacando sus padres adelante, ofreciéndoles una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas. Ahora, Hector se encuentra casado y tiene un hijo de 1 año de nacido, y gracias a que el dueño del negocio donde trabajaba le ofreció la gran oportunidad de hacerse dueño de la cafetería, Hector ha venido trabajando fuertemente para poder cumplir con el dinero que debe pagar y así poder tener su propio negocio. A pesar de las dificultades económicas que siempre ha tenido, la fortaleza y el esfuerzo diario que hace en su trabajo le han permitido salir adelante y superar las grandes adversidades que se le presentan; y ahora que tiene la oportunidad, Hector busca un préstamo para comprar comidas fritas y algunos otros insumos que requiere en su cafetería para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es llegar a tener un restaurante y aspira a que lo pueda lograr si sigue trabajando fuertemente. Además, aspira a poder mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus padres, su esposa y su hijo de 1 año.
texts.en:
Héctor’s a very tenacious young man who has worked hard in life to get ahead and to be able to help his parents because he comes from a family of very low economic resources.  Some time ago he got a job working in a cafeteria and through hard work has been moving his parents forward offering them a better quality of life and greater economic opportunities.  

Now, Héctor is married and has a one-year-old son.  The owner of the business he’s employed at has given him the opportunity of buying the cafeteria and Héctor has been working very hard to earn the money he needs to pay for it and thus to have his own business.  Despite the economic difficulties he’s always had his strength and daily efforts at work have made it possible for him to move forward and overcome the great difficulties that arise.  Now that he has this opportunity, Héctor is looking for a loan to buy fried food and some other ingredients he needs in the cafeteria to provide better customer service.  

His greatest dream is to have a restaurant and hopes to do so which is why he continues working hard.  He also hopes to improve his parents’, his wife’s and his one-year-old son’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fried food and ingredients for his snack bar.

loans.name: Maria Yaneth

texts.es:
Maria trabaja en la actividad de la confección desde hace muchos años gracias a que su madre se dedicaba a esta actividad y desde muy joven se la enseñó. Gracias a esto, logró conseguir trabajo en una empresa donde ha trabajado durante los últimos años y debido a que ahora requiere estar al cuidado de sus 2 hijos se vio obligada a dejar su trabajo. Sin embargo, ya que los ingresos de su esposo no son suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, Maria ha decidido montar su propio taller de confección en su casa donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros y así poder contribuir económicamente en su hogar. Ya lleva unas semanas trabajando en su taller y debido al poco capital con el que cuenta, busca un préstamo para comprar insumos como telas e hilos y poder confeccionar los pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es tener un gran taller de confección que le permita sacar su familia adelante y poder ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Maria has worked as a seamstress for many years, because her mother also worked in this sector and taught her from a young age. Thanks to this, she was able to get work in a business where she worked in recent years. Since she now has to care for her two children, she had to leave her job. However, since her husband's income is not enough to maintain household expenses, Maria has decided to start her own seamstress shop in her home, where she offers sewing services to others and this way she can contribute economically to her household. She has been working in her shop for some weeks and because she has little capital, she is looking for a loan to buy supplies like fabric and thread to be able to sew the orders from her customers. 

Her greatest dream is to have a large sewing shop that will allow her to advance her family and be able to give her two children a better education.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric and thread and to be able to sew the orders from her customers

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn is a 39-year-old mother of five children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

The main source of family’s income is from rice farming on one hectare of farmland.  Her husband supplements the family’s income through fishing.  They have been in this business for almost twenty years. The current business earns her approximately KHR 8,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. Lacking working capital is the main challenge for her business. 

Thorn's group consists of two members who live in the same village of the Kror Kor district, Pursat province. She is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. She successfully used her first loan from VisionFund to better support her business. 

Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan. Thorn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline. She previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to buy supplies like detergent, fabric softener and other materials that she uses in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan. She will use it to buy some supplies needed in her laundry business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Evangeline dreams to open new branches and hopes to get more customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy some supplies for her laundry business

loans.name: Seb's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area of the Battambang province's Thmor Koul district of Cambodia, Seb is a 52-year-old widowed mother of four children. Three of her children are dependent on her; some are in school and some have jobs. 

She has struggled to make a living through rice farming on two hectares of farmland for almost thirty years. Lacking a water supply is still the main challenge for her business. 

Seb's group consists of two members who live in the same village, and this is the second loan with VisionFund for her group. She successfully repaid the first loan, which helped her to better support her family. She is leading her group to ask for a loan; she is seeking 200,000 Riel (KHR) while the other group member is applying for 700,000 KHR. Seb is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Aged 31 years, Yorn is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham provice, Cambodia. She has two daughters, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice on two hectares of farmland, planting cassava on 1.5 hectares of farmland, and by raising pigs, which she and her husband have been doing almost ten years. The low price of cassava is the still the main challenge for her business. 

This is Yorn's third loan with Kiva's partner VisionFund. The past loans have helped her to relieve her family's burden and improve her livelihood. Now she is request a loan with VisionFund of 4,000,000 Riel (KHR). With this loan, Yorn is going to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her family to generate more income from the current business so as to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn is 42 years old and lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. He has two sons, both of whom are dependent on him and still in school. 

He has earned a living through farming rice and planting cassava for 22 years to support the family. The current business earns him about 20,000 KHR and lets him to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. The low price of cassava is still the main challenge for his business. 

Thorn’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. He is now in the fifth cycle. He completely paid back the past loans, which have helped him relieve his family’s burden and keep his children’s education. 

Now he is leading his group, consisting of three, to request a loan with VisionFund, Thorn will use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor in transplanting rice. 

He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from the current business, so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Lazokat

texts.ru: Лазокат старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Ей 57 лет она вдова и имеет 6 детей. Ее дети работают, но их зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Лазокат решила помочь детям для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур, как пшеница, кукуруза и помидор, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих внуков с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Lazokat is trying to improve her living conditions and her family's finances. She is a 57-year-old widow with 6 children. The children work, but their salaries are insufficient to provide the family with all necessities of life. Lazokat has decided to help her children for the family's benefit. With this in mind, she took the course "Succeed" organized by the Association of Businesswomen and obtained her graduation certificate. Now she is quite capable of starting her own business and becoming successful. Lazokat has decided to focus her business on cultivating crops such as wheat, corn and tomatoes, as she has experience in this area. She plans to use her profits to provide quality food and education to her grandchildren.

Lazokat is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for her new business. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for her new business

loans.name: Bogigul

texts.ru:
Богигул 49 - летняя жительница города Сарбанд. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Богигул имеет среднее образование. У нее имеется богатый опыт в области торговли. 
Богигул намерена заняться своим бизнесом. Она у себя дома хочет открыт продуктовый магазин. Богигул просит кредит для приобретения продуктов и хозяйственных товаров, чтобы открыть свой магазин.
texts.en: Bogigul is a 49-year-old resident of the city of Sarband. She is married and has four children. Bogigul has secondary education and a wealth of experience in retail. She is planning to launch her own business by opening a grocery store in her home. Bogigul is requesting this loan to purchase food products and household goods for her new store.

loans.use: to purchase food and household items for her new grocery store

loans.name: Soch's Group

texts.en:
Soch is a villager from a rural area of the Kampong Cham province in the Dambae district, Cambodia. She is 63 years old and married. She has six children. To support her family, she has been farming rice and supplementing her income by growing cassava on 1.5 hectares of farmland and sugarcane on two hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for thirty years, she can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. The low price of cassava is the main challenge for her business. 

Soch’s group consists of two members, and this is her second loan with VisionFund. She completely repaid back the past loan, which has helped with her family's needs. Now, she and her group member are applying for a loan with VisionFund in the amount of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better  living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.es:
Maria tiene una gran experiencia en la actividad de la venta de comidas rápidas y con este negocio aporta económicamente en su hogar para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su ella, su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Debido a que su familia tenía grandes dificultades económicas, Maria decidió comenzar con un negocio que le permitiera aportar económicamente en su hogar para mejorar esta situación, y fue así como comenzó a vender comidas rápidas y ahora tiene una gran experiencia y tiene muy buenos clientes. A pesar de que tiene mucho tiempo trabajando en la actividad, la situación económica en su hogar ha sido un poco complicada principalmente porque sus 2 hijos están comenzando sus estudios universitarios y puede aportar para que puedan acceder a ellos, pero esto hace que se descuiden otros aspectos económicos de gran importancia para su hogar. Buscando superar su dificultad de capital, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar una sombrilla grande para su negocio y cubrirlo de las lluvias cuando sea necesario.

De esta manera sus ventas aumentarán considerablemente ya que podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así seguirá saliendo adelante con su familia. Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener un restaurante donde pueda ofrecer empleo para las demás personas.
texts.en:
María has much experience in the fast-food business and contributes economically to cover her, her husband’s and her two children’s  household expenses with this business.  Because her family had great economic difficulties, María decided to start a business that would make it possible for her to contribute economically to her household and to improve this situation.  This is how she started selling fast-food and now has vast experience and very good customers.

Despite working in this business for quite some time, the economic situation at home has been a bit complicated especially because her two children have started their university studies and she can contribute so that they can have access to them and this causes other important economic aspects at home to be neglected.  Seeking for find a way to overcome her capital difficulty, María is looking for a loan to buy a large umbrella for her business to shelter it from the rain when necessary.  In this way, sales will increase considerably because she will be able to offer better customer service and continue to move forward with her family.  Her greatest dream is to have a restaurant where she can provide jobs for others.

loans.use: to buy a large umbrella for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chair-making supplies.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn, who is 50 years old, lives with her four children in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother. 

She has struggled to feed and care for her children by farming rice, raising pigs, planting cassava, and supplementing family’s income by distilling alcohol. She has been in this business for twenty years. She can earn about KHR 40,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. The main challenge for her business is the low price of cassava in the market.

Yorn received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. 

Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Yorn will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland and a portion of it to buy the pig's feed. 

She hopes to sell the cassava and pig for a good price in the market, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland and the pig's feed.

loans.name: Alberto Manuel

texts.es:
Alberto siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y esto le ha permitido salir adelante junto a su familia a pesar de las grandes dificultades que se le han presentado en la vida. Alberto se encuentra casado y tiene 5 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar el acceso a una educación de buena calidad, por esto ha trabajado fuertemente en busca de mejores condiciones económicas para su hogar. Hace mucho tiempo trabajaba como empleado y durante un tiempo también trabajó para un familiar; allí aprendió la actividad de la venta de productos de la canasta familiar y con unos ahorros y un gran esfuerzo montó su propia tienda general donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta familiar. Desde que tiene su tienda, hace unos pocos años, la calidad de vida en su hogar ha mejorado considerablemente, y a pesar de que no cuenta con un gran capital y aún le faltan muchos productos para ofrecer a los clientes, su gran esfuerzo ha permitido que su negocio salga adelante y cada vez siga creciendo. Ya que no cuenta con un gran capital, y buscando ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos para sus clientes, Alberto busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos.

Su sueño es salir con este negocio adelante y así poderles ofrecer a sus 5 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mejores posibilidades económicas para progresar. Además, sueña con que este negocio siga creciendo para que en un futuro pueda ser un negocio de trascendencia familiar y sus hijos tengan un trabajo estable.
texts.en:
Alberto has always been noted for being very hardworking; this has allowed him and his family to carry on despite the great difficulties that have presented themselves in his life. Alberto is married and has five children to whom he has always wanted to offer access to high-quality education. That's why he has worked hard to seek better economic conditions for his household. 

A long time ago, he worked as an employee, and for a while he also worked for a relative. There, he learned the business of selling groceries and everyday household goods. Since he got his own store a few years ago, the quality of life in his household has improved considerably. Despite the fact that he doesn't have a great deal of capital and he still lacks many products that he could offer his customers, his hard work has kept his business open and growing. 

Since he doesn't have much capital, and wants to offer a greater variety of products to his customers, Alberto is seeking a loan to buy more inventory and be able to offer his customers more variety. His dream is to carry on with his business and be able to offer his five children a better quality of life and better opportunities to progress economically. In addition, he dreams of his business continuing to grow so that in the future the store can remain in the family and his children will have stable work.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his general store so he can offer his customers a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz estudió durante 3 años el oficio de la peluquería y trabajó en un salón de belleza durante un largo tiempo, pero hace unos meses decidió independizarse y montar su propio salón de belleza para poder tener mejores condiciones económicas en su hogar y así apoyar a sus padres para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Es así como ha salido adelante con su salón de belleza donde ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes y gracias a esto su calidad de vida ha mejorado considerablemente. Gracias a que cada vez viene creciendo más, Beatriz busca ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio; es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar herramientas de trabajo para su peluquería y poder prestar un servicio de mejor calidad.

Su sueño es poder tener un gran salón de belleza donde pueda generar empleo para muchas personas y desde el cual logre sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Beatriz studied hairstyling for three years and worked in a beauty salon for a long time but a few months ago decided to become independent and open her own beauty salon in order to have better economic conditions at home and thus help her parents to have a better quality of lie.
She’s been getting ahead with her beauty salon and has won over a large number of customers.  Thanks to this her quality of life has improved considerably.  Thanks to her constant growth, Beatriz wants to offer better customer service and that’s why she’s looking for financing to buy work tools for her beauty salon to provide better quality service.  Her dream is to have a large beauty salon where she can generate employment for many people and to be able to support her family through it.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is Daisy.   She previously received a PHP 20,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in meeting her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Daisy hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future by working hard on her business.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en:
Edmond is in his fifties and lives in the east central part of Albania. He has been receiving just a small disability income for some time now that hasn’t been enough, according to him. However, the little business Edmond has been having on the side, has provided a very little profit for himself and his paralyzed mother, just enough to have basic food on the table. 

For the past ten something years, Edmond has been working as a street vendor selling small things in the streets. Now he plans to buy more vending supplies, snacks and other items, that will increase his profit. To achieve this, Edmond is requesting a loan from Kiva. At the same time, Edmond is seeking lenders' assistance in this matter.

loans.use: To buy more vending supplies & snacks for sale

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 4 hijos a quienes su padre abandonó hace un tiempo sin hacer alguna contribución económica para su sostenimiento, por lo que en los últimos años ha venido padeciendo algunos problemas económicos en su hogar. Desde hace unos 7 años comenzó con la actividad de la confección ofreciendo el servicio de confección a terceros, y gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos ahora puede contar con muy buenos clientes que le permiten generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital, ha tenido que dejar pasar muy buenos pedidos de sus clientes; pero ahora que tiene la oportunidad, Emperatriz busca un préstamo para comprar insumos como telas e hilos y poder fabricar los grandes pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que le brinde la posibilidad de sacar sus 4 hijos adelante brindándoles una educación de buena calidad. Además sueña con tener su línea propia de ropa y que esta sea reconocida en el mercado.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is a single mother, head of household for her four children who their father abandoned some time ago without making any economic contribution towards their support.  Because of this, she’s been going through some difficult economic times at home in the last few years.  

About 7 years ago she started a business sewing for third parties and thanks to the good quality of her work she now has very good customers that make it possible for her to earn income to support her home.  Because she does not have much capital, she’s had to let several good customer orders pass her by but now that she has the opportunity, Emperatriz is looking for a loan to buy supplies like fabric and thread to manufacture the large pending customer orders she has.

Her dream is to move the business forward so that it will give her the opportunity to move her four children ahead providing them with a good quality education.  She also dreams with having her own clothing line that’s well-known in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор уже один раз пользовался кредитом от КИВА. За счет этого кредита Виктор смог закупить инструмент для производства мебели – купил компрессор и пневмостеплер. Это оборудование помогло облегчить труд, а качество производимой мебели сразу улучшилось на порядок. Более того, Виктор смог также приобрести оборудование для изготовления тентов – теперь он со своими работниками также изготавливает тенты для грузовых автомобилей. Со времени получения последнего кредита от КИВА Виктор с семьей смог также закончить ремонт и переехал в свой дом, до этого семья жила на квартире. Теперь гораздо больше места для всех, так как семья большая. Виктор также расширил и свой бизнес – он арендовал большой склад с большим цехом для работы и большим двором. Теперь хватает места и для мебели, и для склада, и есть где заниматься тентовкой автомобилей.  
Виктор планирует вложить следующий кредит от КИВА в размере 10 000 гривен в закупку дополнительной партии материала для бизнеса, а именно поролона, тканей, дерева и других расходных материалов. Кредит даст возможность иметь запас материала, а не ждать, когда он поступит. Соответственно, за счет полученных средств от КИВА Виктор ускорит выполнение заказов. Осенью всегда больше заказов и он хочет подготовиться. Основной трудностью для себя в работе считает процесс поиска и обучения новых работников, так как обучение зачастую занимает долгое время, а многие в итоге бросают работу.
texts.en:
Viktor has already received one loan from Kiva. Using these funds, he was able to purchase tools for manufacturing furniture - an air compressor and a pneumatic stapler. This equipment has made work easier, and also improved the quality of the final product by an order of magnitude. Furthermore, Viktor was able to buy tools for manufacturing tents - now he and his staff can make tarpaulins for trucks. Since receiving his last loan from Kiva, Viktor and his family have finished home repairs and moved into their own house, while previously they lived in an apartment. Now everyone in their large family has more space. Finally, Viktor also expanded his business - he rented a large workshop with a big yard, which has given him enough space for making both furniture and tarpaulins.

Viktor is planning to invest his next Kiva loan of 10 000 hryvnia into purchasing additional materials for his business, namely foam, fabric, wood and other consumables. The loan will enable him to keep stocks of such materials on hand, instead of always waiting for them to arrive. Accordingly, with these Kiva funds Viktor will accelerate the turnaround of his orders. Fall is a busy time for orders, and he wants to be ready. Viktor considers that the main obstacle in his work is finding and training new employees, as the training takes a long time, while many people eventually leave the job.

loans.use: to purchase additional foam, fabric, wood and other consumables for his furniture making business

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es:
Juan Guillermo se dedica a la producción de productos agrícolas orgánicos y al levante de animales, como gallinas y pollos; dicha actividad la heredó de su padre quien desde muy joven se la enseñó y esto ha permitido que tenga una gran experiencia en la actividad. Con este negocio genera los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para sostener los gastos que allí se derivan, y también poder ofrecerle a su hijo de 9 años una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de buena calidad. Gracias a que su negocio viene creciendo, las dificultades económicas que padecían en su hogar se han venido superando, y ahora también tiene una gran cantidad de gallinas y pollos que, debido a que tiene un galpón muy pequeño debe dejar por fuera sin encerrar. Buscando mejorar esta situación, Juan Guillermo busca un préstamo para adecuar un galpón más grande donde quepan todas las gallinas y los pollos y poder seguir ofreciendo una buena calidad a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es que este negocio salga adelante y su hijo pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan Guillermo produces organic agricultural goods and raises animals, such as hens and chickens. He learned this work from his father, who taught him about it from the time Juan Guillermo was very young, which has given him great experience. The business generates the income Juan Guillermo needs to meet his household expenses, and also to offer a good quality of life and access to education for his nine-year-old son. Thanks to the fact that his business continues to grow, he has been able to overcome the economic difficulties he used to have at home, and now he has a lot of hens and chickens. Because the shed is very small, Juan Guillermo has to leave them outside. In order to improve this situation, Juan Guillermo is asking for a loan to build a larger shed with room for all the hens and chickens, also allowing him to offer better quality to his clients. His greatest dream is that the business will continue to grow, and that his son can achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build a larger shed with room for all the hens and chickens, and to be able to offer better quality to his clients.

loans.name: Erika Julieth

texts.es:
Erika es una joven emprendedora que desde hace unos años montó una tienda general en busca de mejorar la condición económica que tenía en su hogar cuando convivía con sus padres. Ahora que se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos, esta es una fuente de ingresos que le permite contribuir económicamente junto con su esposo para que en su hogar puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar. A pesar de que no cuenta con un gran capital, su negocio lo ha sacado adelante con un gran esfuerzo y esto le ha permitido venir aumentando la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes. Debido a que en el sector le han puesto mucha competencia abriendo tiendas de este mismo tipo, Erika requiere diferenciarse de la competencia para poder conservar sus clientes; es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar con los que pueda diversificar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes y así superar la competencia que le han puesto en el sector.

Su mayor sueño es brindarle a sus 2 hijos una educación de buena calidad y poderles ofrecer un futuro económico estable con el que puedan salir adelante. También sueña con que su negocio crezca y en un futuro pueda ser una fuente de ingresos que les permita progresar económicamente.
texts.en:
Erika is a young entrepreneur who opened a general store a few years ago looking to improve the economic condition her household had when she lived with her parents.  Now that she’s married and  has two children, this is a source of income that allows her to help her husband maintain a better quality of life at home and to have better opportunities for economic progress.  

Despite not having much capital, her business has moved forward thanks to her great effort and she’s been increasing the variety of products she has available for her customers.  Because she’s gotten much competition with similar stores opening up locally, Erika wants to stand out from the competition in order to retain her customers which is why she’s seeking a loan to buy basic staple items to diversify her inventory of products on sale to her customers to overcome the competition that’s arisen in her neighborhood.

Her greatest dream is to provide her two children with a quality education and a future that’s economically stable so that they can get ahead.  She also dreams with her business growing and in future becoming a source of income that will allow them to progress economically.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a special sewing machine that will help her increase production and respond to larger customer orders.

loans.name: Martha Marleny

texts.es:
Medellín

Martha es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado superar grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a la venta de productos de uso personal y con esto ha contribuido económicamente junto con su esposo para brindar en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
